original: anitya varga
analyzed: anitya varga
translated: Impermanence

original: siddham
analyzed: siddham
translated: Established

original: stīnam iddham vinodya iha sampraharṣya ca mānasam / stīnamiddham
analyzed: stīnam iddham vinodya iha sampraharṣya ca mānasam stīnam iddham
translated: Having removed sloth and drowsiness here, and having delighted the mind, sloth and drowsiness

original: śṛṇuta imam pravakṣyāmi udānam jina bhāṣitam //
analyzed: śṛṇuta imam pravakṣyāmi udānam jina bhāṣitam
translated: Listen to this I will proclaim the Udana spoken by the Victor.

original: evam uktam bhagavatā sarva abhijñena tāyinā /
analyzed: evam uktam bhagavatā sarva abhijñena tāyinā
translated: Thus it was spoken by the Blessed One, the Omniscient Protector,

original: anukampakena ṛṣiṇā śarīra antima dhāriṇā //
analyzed: anukampakena ṛṣiṇā śarīra antima dhāriṇā
translated: By the compassionate Rishi, the bearer of his last body.

original: anityā bata saṃskārā utpāda vyaya dharmiṇaḥ /
analyzed: anityāḥ bata saṃskārāḥ utpāda vyaya dharmiṇaḥ
translated: Oh, impermanent are conditioned things, having the nature of arising and passing away.

original: utpadya hi nirudhyante teṣām vyupaśamaḥ sukham //
analyzed: utpadya hi nirudhyante teṣām vyupaśamaḥ sukham
translated: For having arisen, they cease; their cessation is happiness.

original: ko nu harṣaḥ ka /ānanda /evam prajvalite sati /
analyzed: kaḥ nu harṣaḥ ka ānanda evam prajvalite sati
translated: What joy, what delight, when thus burning?

original: andha kāram praviṣṭāḥ stha pradīpam na gaveṣatha //
analyzed: andha kāram praviṣṭāḥ stha pradīpam na gaveṣatha
translated: You have entered darkness, yet you do not seek a lamp.

original: yāni imāny apaviddhāni vikṣiptāni diśo diśam /
analyzed: yāni imāni apaviddhāni vikṣiptāni diśaḥ diśam
translated: These scattered, thrown about in all directions,

original: kapota varṇāny asthīni tāni drṣṭvā iha kā ratiḥ //
analyzed: kapota varṇāni asthīni tāni drṣṭvā iha kā ratiḥ
translated: Seeing these bones, the color of pigeons, what joy is there here?

original: yām eva prathamām rātrim garbhe vasati mānavaḥ /
analyzed: yām eva prathamām rātrim garbhe vasati mānavaḥ
translated: On the very first night a human dwells in the womb,

original: aviṣṭhitaḥ sa vrajati gataś ca na nivartate //🔽sāyam eke na dṛśyante kālyam dṛṣṭā mahā janāḥ /
analyzed: a viṣṭhitaḥ sa vrajati gataḥ ca na nivartate  sāyam eke na dṛśyante kālyam dṛṣṭā mahā janāḥ
translated: Unceasing, he moves on; having gone, he does not return.🔽Some in the evening are not seen, great people seen in the morning,

original: kālyam ca eke na dṛṣyante sāyam dṛṣṭā mahā janāḥ //
analyzed: kālyam ca eke na dṛṣyante sāyam dṛṣṭā mahā janāḥ
translated: And some in the morning are not seen, great people seen in the evening.

original: tatra ko viśvasen martyo daharo asmi iti jīvite /
analyzed: tatra kaḥ viśvaset martyaḥ daharaḥ asmi iti jīvite
translated: Who among mortals would have faith in this, that he is young and will live?

original: daharā api ṃriyante hi narā nāryaś canekaśaḥ // anekaśaḥ🔽garbha /eke vinaśyante tathā eke sūtikā kule /
analyzed: daharāḥ api ṃriyante hi narāḥ nāryaḥ canekaśas anekaśas  garbhaeke vinaśyante tathā eke sūtikā kule
translated: For many men and women die while still young.🔽Some perish in the womb, and some in the delivery room.

original: parisṛptās tathā hy eke tathā eke paridhāvinaḥ //
analyzed: parisṛptāḥ tathā hi eke tathā eke paridhāvinaḥ
translated: Some die while crawling, and some while running about.

original: ye ca vṛddhā ye ca dahrā ye ca madhyama puruṣāḥ / pūruṣāḥ🔽anupūrvam pravrajanti phalam pakvam va bandhanāt //
analyzed: ye ca vṛddhā ye ca dahrā ye ca madhyama puruṣāḥ pūruṣāḥ  anupūrvam pravrajanti phalam pakvam va bandhanāt
translated: Whether old, young, or middle-aged,🔽men go forth in due course, like fruit falling from a ripe bond.

original: yathā phalānām pakvānām nityam patanato bhayam /
analyzed: yathā phalānām pakvānām nityam patanataḥ bhayam
translated: Just as ripe fruit is always in danger of falling,

original: evam jātasya martyasya nityam maraṇato bhayam //
analyzed: evam jātasya martyasya nityam maraṇataḥ bhayam
translated: so a mortal born is always in danger of death.

original: yathā api kumbha kāreṇa mṛttikā bhājanam kṛtam /
analyzed: yathā api kumbha kāreṇa mṛttikā bhājanam kṛtam
translated: Just as a potter makes earthenware vessels from clay,

original: sarvam bhedana paryantam evam martyasya jīvitam //
analyzed: sarvam bhedana paryantam evam martyasya jīvitam
translated: and all of them are liable to breakage, so is the life of a mortal.

original: yathā api tantre vitate yad yad uktam samupyate /🔽alpam bhavati vātavyam evam martyasya jīvitam //🔽yathā api va /
analyzed: yathā api tantre vitate yat yat uktam samupyate  alpam bhavati vātavyam evam martyasya jīvitam  yathā api
translated: Just as whatever is woven on a loom is measured out,

original: ghatano bhavati /evam martyasya jīvitam //
analyzed: bhavati evam martyasya jīvitam
translated: so is the life of a mortal measured out.

original: yathā nadī pārvatīyā gacchate na nivartate /
analyzed: yathā nadī pārvatīyā gacchate na nivartate
translated: Just as a river flowing from the mountains goes on and does not return,🔽so is the life of a mortal.

original: evam āyur manuṣyāṇām gacchate na nivartate //
analyzed: evam āyuḥ manuṣyāṇām gacchate na nivartate
translated: In this way, the life of humans passes away and does not return.

original: kisaram ca parittam ca tac ca duhkhena samyutam /
analyzed: kisaram ca parittam ca tat ca duhkhena samyutam
translated: And that life is short and limited, and is full of suffering.

original: udake daṇḍa rājī iva kṣipram eva vinaśyati //
analyzed: udake daṇḍa rājī iva kṣipram eva vinaśyati
translated: It perishes quickly, like a line drawn on water.

original: yathā daṇḍena gopālo gāḥ prāpayati gocaram /
analyzed: yathā daṇḍena gopālaḥ gāḥ prāpayati gocaram
translated: Just as a cowherd drives the cows to pasture with a stick,

original: evam rogair jarā mṛtyuḥ āyuḥ prāpayate nṛṇām //
analyzed: evam rogaiḥ jarā mṛtyuḥ āyuḥ prāpayate nṛṇām
translated: In the same way, old age, disease and death drive life to its end for humans.

original: atiyānti hy aho rātrā jīvitam ca uparudhyate /
analyzed: atiyānti hi ahar rātrāḥ jīvitam ca uparudhyate
translated: The days and nights pass by, and life is cut short.

original: āyuḥ kṣīyati martyānām kunadīṣu yathā odakam //
analyzed: āyuḥ kṣīyati martyānām kunadīṣu yathā odakam
translated: The life of mortals is wasted away, like water in small streams.

original: jīvitam ca uparudhyate /
analyzed: jīvitam ca uparudhyate
translated: Life is cut short.

original: dīrghā jāgarato rātrir dīrgham śrāntasya yojanam /
analyzed: dīrghā jāgarataḥ rātriḥ dīrgham śrāntasya yojanam
translated: The night is long for one who is awake, the journey is long for one who is tired,

original: dīrgho bālasya saṃsāraḥ saddharmam avijānataḥ //
analyzed: dīrghaḥ bālasya saṃsāraḥ saddharmam a vijānataḥ
translated: The saṃsāra of a child is long, who does not know the true Dharma.

original: putro me asti dhanam me asti ity evam bālo vihanyate /
analyzed: putraḥ me asti dhanam me asti iti evam bālaḥ vihanyate
translated: I have a son, I have wealth, thus a fool is deluded.

original: ātmā eva hy ātmano na asti kasya putraḥ kuto dhanam //
analyzed: ātmā eva hi ātmanaḥ na asti kasya putraḥ kutas dhanam
translated: For one's self is one's own self, who has a son, and from where is wealth?

analyzed: maraṇe
translated: At the time of death...

original: anekāni sahasrāṇi nara nārī śatāni ca /
analyzed: anekāni sahasrāṇi nara nārī śatāni ca
translated: Many thousands, and hundreds of men and women,

original: bhogān vai samudānīya vaśam gacchanti mṛtyunaḥ //
analyzed: bhogān vai samudānīya vaśam gacchanti mṛtyunaḥ
translated: Having accumulated enjoyments, come under the power of death.

original: sarve kṣaya antā nicayāḥ patana antāḥ samucchrayāḥ /
analyzed: sarve kṣaya antāḥ nicayāḥ patana antāḥ samucchrayāḥ
translated: All that is accumulated ends in depletion, all that is raised up ends in a fall,

original: samyogā viprayoga antā maraṇa antam hi jīvitam //
analyzed: samyogā viprayoga antā maraṇa antam hi jīvitam
translated: all that is united ends in separation, and all life ends in death.

original: sarve sattvā mariṣyanti maraṇa antam hi jīvitam / satvā🔽yathā karma gamiṣyanti puṇya pāpa phala upagāḥ //
analyzed: sarve sattvāḥ mariṣyanti maraṇa antam hi jīvitam satvā  yathā karma gamiṣyanti puṇya pāpa phala upagāḥ
translated: All beings will die, for life ends in death.🔽Beings will go according to their karma, experiencing the fruits of their good and bad deeds.

original: narakam pāpa karmāṇaḥ kṛta puṇyās tu sad gatim /
analyzed: narakam pāpa karmāṇaḥ kṛta puṇyāḥ tu sat gatim
translated: Those of evil deeds will go to hell, while those who have done good will go to a good realm.

original: anye tu mārgam bhāvya iha nirvāsyanti nirāsravāḥ // bhāvyeha
analyzed: anye tu mārgam bhāvya iha nirvāsyanti nirāsravāḥ bhāvya iha
translated: Others, having cultivated the path here, will attain nirvana, free from defilements.

original: na eva antarīk se na samudra madhye na parvatānām vivaram praviśya /
analyzed: na eva antarīk se na samudra madhye na parvatānām vivaram praviśya
translated: There is no place in the sky, in the middle of the ocean, or by entering the crevices of mountains,

original: na vidyate asau pṛthivī pradeśo yatra sthitam na prasaheta mṛtyuH //
analyzed: na vidyate asau pṛthivī pradeśaḥ yatra sthitam na prasaheta mṛtyuḥ
translated: where one can stay and escape death.

original: ye ca iha bhūtā bhaviṣyanti vā punaḥ sarve gamiṣyanti prahāya deham /
analyzed: ye ca iha bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti vā punar sarve gamiṣyanti prahāya deham
translated: Whether beings are present now or will be in the future, all will leave their bodies and go.

original: tām sarva hānim kuśalo viditvā dharme sthito brahmacaryam careta //
analyzed: tām sarva hānim kuśalaḥ viditvā dharme sthitaḥ brahmacaryam careta
translated: The wise one, knowing all this loss, should abide in the Dharma and practice celibacy.

original: jīrṇam ca dṛṣṭvā iha tathā eva rogiṇam mṛtam ca dṛṣṭvā vyapayāta cetasam /
analyzed: jīrṇam ca dṛṣṭvā iha tathā eva rogiṇam mṛtam ca dṛṣṭvā vyapayāta cetasam
translated: Having seen the aged here, and likewise the sick, and having seen the dead with their minds departed,

original: jahau sa dhīro gṛha bandhanāni kāmā hi lokasya na supraheyāḥ //
analyzed: jahau sa dhīraḥ gṛha bandhanāni kāmāḥ hi lokasya na su praheyāḥ
translated: The wise one gave up the bonds of home, for desires are not easily abandoned by the world.

original: jīryanti vai rāja rathāḥ sucitrā hy atho śarīram api jarām upaiti /
analyzed: jīryanti vai rāja rathāḥ su citrāḥ hi atha u śarīram api jarām upaiti
translated: Royal chariots, though well-adorned, grow old, and even the body succumbs to old age.

original: satām tu dharmo na jarām upaiti santo hi tam satsu nivedayanti //
analyzed: satām tu dharmaḥ na jarām upaiti santaḥ hi tam satsu nivedayanti
translated: But the dharma of the good does not succumb to old age, for the good proclaim it among the good.

original: dhik tvām astu jare grāmye virūpa karaṇī hy asi /
analyzed: dhik tvām astu jare grāmye virūpa karaṇī hi asi
translated: Shame on you, old age, you who are vulgar and disfiguring!

original: tathā mano ramam bimbam jarayā hy abhimarditam //
analyzed: tathā manaḥ ramam bimbam jarayā hi abhimarditam
translated: For the beautiful form that delights the mind is crushed by old age.

original: yo api varṣa śatam jīvet so api mṛtyu parāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yo api varṣa śatam jīvet saḥ api mṛtyu parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Even if one lives for a hundred years, one is still subject to death.

original: anu hy enam jarā hanti vyādhir vā yadi vā antakaḥ //
analyzed: anu hi enam jarā hanti vyādhiḥ vā yadi vā antakaḥ
translated: For old age, disease, or the Destroyer will surely kill one.

original: sadā vrajanti hy anivartamānā divā ca rātrau ca vilujyamānāḥ /
analyzed: sadā vrajanti hi a nivartamānāḥ divā ca rātrau ca vilujyamānāḥ
translated: They always go on, not returning, day and night, being destroyed.

original: matsyā /iva atīva hi tapyamānā duhkhena jāti maraṇena yuktāḥ //
analyzed: matsyāiva atīva hi tapyamānāḥ duhkhena jāti maraṇena yuktāḥ
translated: Like fish, they are greatly tormented, bound by birth and death.

original: āyur divā ca rātrau ca caratas tiṣṭhatas tathā /
analyzed: āyuḥ divā ca rātrau ca carataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ tathā
translated: Life passes for one who moves or stands, day and night.

original: nadīnām vā yathā sroto gacchate na nivartate //
analyzed: nadīnām vā yathā srotaḥ gacchate na nivartate
translated: Just as the current of rivers goes and does not return.

original: yeṣām rātri diva apāye hy āyur alpataram bhavet /
analyzed: yeṣām rātri diva apāye hi āyuḥ alpataram bhavet
translated: For those whose life span decreases day and night,

original: alpa udake va matsyānām kā nu teṣām ratir bhavet //
analyzed: alpa udake va matsyānām kā nu teṣām ratiḥ bhavet
translated: What pleasure can they have in a little water like fish?

original: parijīrṇam idam rūpam roga nīḍam prabhaṅguram /
analyzed: parijīrṇam idam rūpam roga nīḍam prabhaṅguram
translated: This body is decaying, a nest of diseases, and fragile.

original: bhetsyate pūty asaṃdeham maraṇa antam hi jīvitam //
analyzed: bhetsyate pūti asaṃdeham maraṇa antam hi jīvitam
translated: It will certainly break, being foul and mortal.

original: aciram bata kāyo ayam pṛthivīm adhiśeṣyate /
analyzed: aciram bata kāyaḥ ayam pṛthivīm adhiśeṣyate
translated: Soon, alas, this body will lie on the ground,

original: śunyo vyapeta vijñāno nirastam vā kaḍaṅgaram // śūnyo
analyzed: śunyaḥ vyapeta vijñānaḥ nirastam vā kaḍaṅgaram śūnyaḥ
translated: Empty, devoid of consciousness, like a discarded log.

original: kim anena śarīreṇa sravatā pūutinā sadā /
analyzed: kim anena śarīreṇa sravatā pūutinā sadā
translated: What is the use of this body, which is always oozing and foul?

original: nityam roga abhibhūtena jarā maraṇa bhīruṇā //
analyzed: nityam roga abhibhūtena jarā maraṇa bhīruṇā
translated: Constantly afflicted by disease, fearing old age and death?

original: anena pūti kāyena hy ātureṇa prabhaṅguṇā /
analyzed: anena pūti kāyena hi ātureṇa prabhaṅguṇā
translated: By this foul body, which is sick and fragile,

original: nigacchatha parām śāntim yoga kṣemam anuttaram //
analyzed: nigacchatha parām śāntim yoga kṣemam anuttaram
translated: You will attain the highest peace, the unsurpassed security of yoga.

original: iha varṣam kariṣyāmi hemantam grīṣmam eva ca /
analyzed: iha varṣam kariṣyāmi hemantam grīṣmam eva ca
translated: Here I will spend the rainy season, the winter, and the summer.

original: bālo vicintayaty evam antarāyam na paśyati //
analyzed: bālaḥ vicintayati evam antarāyam na paśyati
translated: The fool thinks thus, not seeing the obstacle.

original: tam putra paśu sammattam vyāsakta manasam naram /
analyzed: tam putra paśu sammattam vyāsakta manasam naram
translated: That man, engrossed in his children and cattle, his mind attached,

original: sutpam grāmam mahaugha eva mṛtyur ādāya gacchati // mahaughaiva
analyzed: sutpam grāmam mahā oghaḥ eva mṛtyuḥ ādāya gacchati mahā oghā eva
translated: Death carries him off like a great flood, as if he were a straw.

original: na santi putrās trāṇāya na pitā na api bāndhavāḥ /
analyzed: na santi putrāḥ trāṇāya na pitā na api bāndhavāḥ
translated: There are no sons to save, no father, and no relatives.

original: antakena abhibhūtasya na hi trāṇā bhavanti te //
analyzed: antakena abhibhūtasya na hi trāṇā bhavanti te
translated: When overcome by the Lord of Death, they are no protection.

original: idam kṛtam me kartavyam idam kṛtvā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: idam kṛtam me kartavyam idam kṛtvā bhaviṣyati
translated: Thinking, This is my duty, and, Having done this, I will do that,

original: ity evam spandato martyān jarā mṛtyuś ca mardati //
analyzed: iti evam spandataḥ martyān jarā mṛtyuḥ ca mardati
translated: In this way, old age and death crush mortals who are active.

original: tasmāt sadā dhyāna ratāḥ samāhitā hy ātāpino jāti jarā anta darśinaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sadā dhyāna ratāḥ samāhitāḥ hi ātāpinaḥ jāti jarā anta darśinaḥ
translated: Therefore, monks, always delight in meditation, be concentrated, ardent, and see birth and old age as an end.

original: māram sasainyam hy abhibhūya bhikṣavo bhaveta jātī maraṇasya pāragāḥ //
analyzed: māram sa sainyam hi abhibhūya bhikṣavaḥ bhaveta jātī maraṇasya pāragāḥ
translated: Having overcome Māra and his army, you will reach the other shore of birth and death.

original: kāmavarga
analyzed: kāma varga
translated: Chapter on Sensual Desires

original: kāma jānāmi te mūlam saṃkalpāt kāma jāyase /
analyzed: kāma jānāmi te mūlam saṃkalpāt kāma jāyase
translated: Sensual desire, I know your root: you are born from conceptualization.

original: na tvām saṃkalpayiṣyāmi tato me na bhaviṣyasi //
analyzed: na tvām saṃkalpayiṣyāmi tatas me na bhaviṣyasi
translated: I will not conceptualize you, then you will not exist for me.

original: kāmebhyo jāyate śokaḥ kāmebhyo jāyate bhayam /
analyzed: kāmebhyaḥ jāyate śokaḥ kāmebhyaḥ jāyate bhayam
translated: Sorrow arises from sensual desires, fear arises from sensual desires.

original: kāmebhyo vipramuktānām na asti śokaḥ kuto bhayam //
analyzed: kāmebhyaḥ vipramuktānām na asti śokaḥ kutas bhayam
translated: For those liberated from sensual desires, there is no sorrow, how can there be fear?

original: ratibhyo jāyate śoko ratibhyo jāyate bhayam /
analyzed: ratibhyaḥ jāyate śokaḥ ratibhyaḥ jāyate bhayam
translated: Sorrow arises from pleasures, fear arises from pleasures.

original: ratibhhyo vipramuktānām na asti śokaḥ kuto bhayam //🔽madhura agrā vipāke tu kaṭukā hy abhinanditāḥ /
analyzed: ratibhyaḥ vipramuktānām na asti śokaḥ kutas bhayam  madhura agrā vipāke tu kaṭukāḥ hi abhinanditāḥ
translated: For those liberated from pleasures, there is no sorrow, how can there be fear?🔽Though pleasing at first, in the end they are bitter, being praised.

original: kāmā dahanti vai bālān ulkā iva amuñcataḥ karam //
analyzed: kāmāḥ dahanti vai bālān ulkā iva amuñcataḥ karam
translated: Sensual desires burn fools, like a torch held in the hand.

original: na tad dṛḍham bandhanam āhur āryā yad āyasam dāravam balbajam vā /
analyzed: na tat dṛḍham bandhanam āhuḥ āryāḥ yat āyasam dāravam balbajam vā
translated: The wise do not consider that a strong bondage which is made of iron, wood or reeds.

original: saṃrakta cittasya hi manda buddheḥ putreṣu dāreṣu ca yā /avekṣā //
analyzed: saṃrakta cittasya hi manda buddheḥ putreṣu dāreṣu ca yāavekṣā
translated: But the affection of one who is passionate and slow-witted, the concern for sons and wife,

original: etad dṛḍham bandhanam āhur āryāḥ samantataḥ susthiram duṣpramokṣam /
analyzed: etat dṛḍham bandhanam āhuḥ āryāḥ samantataḥ su sthiram duṣpramokṣam
translated: That, the wise say, is a strong bondage, all around, very firm and difficult to escape.

original: etad api chittvā tu parivrajanti hy anapekṣiṇaḥ kāma sukham prahāya //
analyzed: etat api chittvā tu parivrajanti hi anapekṣiṇaḥ kāma sukham prahāya
translated: Having cut that off too, they wander forth, without concern, having given up the pleasure of sensual desires.

original: na te kāmā yāni citrāṇi loke saṃkalpa rāgaḥ puruṣasya kāmaḥ /
analyzed: na te kāmāḥ yāni citrāṇi loke saṃkalpa rāgaḥ puruṣasya kāmaḥ
translated: Those are not sensual desires which are various in the world. A man's desire is the passion of imagination.

original: tiṣṭhanti citrāṇi tathā eva loke /atha atra dhīrā vinayanti chandam // cchandam
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti citrāṇi tathā eva lokeatha atra dhīrāḥ vinayanti chandam chandam
translated: The various things in the world remain just as they are. But the wise ones control their desire here.

original: na santi nityā manujeṣu kāmāḥ santi tv anityāḥ kāmino yatra baddhāḥ /
analyzed: na santi nityāḥ manujeṣu kāmāḥ santi tu anityāḥ kāminaḥ yatra baddhāḥ
translated: Sensual desires are not permanent among humans. But they are impermanent, to which the passionate are bound.

original: tāṃs tu prahāya hy apunar bhavāya hy anāgatam mṛtyu dheyam vadāmi //
analyzed: tān tu prahāya hi apunar bhavāya hi anāgatam mṛtyu dheyam vadāmi
translated: But having given them up, for the sake of not being reborn, I declare that death is not to come again.

original: chanda jāto hy avasrāvī manasā anāvilo bhavet /
analyzed: chanda jātaḥ hi avasrāvī manasā anāvilaḥ bhavet
translated: One who is born from desire should be one whose mind is not defiled.

original: kāmeṣu tv apratibaddha citta /ūrdhva sroto nirucyate //
analyzed: kāmeṣu tu srotaḥ nirucyate
translated: One whose mind is not attached to sensual desires is said to be one whose stream goes upwards.

original: anupūrveṇa medhāvī stokam stokam kṣaṇe kṣaṇe /
analyzed: anupūrveṇa medhāvī stokam stokam kṣaṇe kṣaṇe
translated: The wise one, step by step, little by little, moment by moment,

original: karmāro rajatasya eva nirdhamen malam ātmanaḥ //
analyzed: karmāraḥ rajatasya eva nirdhamet malam ātmanaḥ
translated: a goldsmith would blow away the impurities of silver.

original: ratha kāra /iva carmaṇaḥ parikartann upānaham /
analyzed: ratha kārā eva carmaṇaḥ parikartan upānaham
translated: Just as a chariot-maker cuts out the sole of a shoe from leather,

original: yad yaj jahāti kāmānām tat tat sampadyate sukham //
analyzed: yat yat jahāti kāmānām tat tat sampadyate sukham
translated: whatever one gives up of desires, that alone becomes happiness.

original: sarvam cet sukham iccheta sarva kāmān parityajet / kāmām
analyzed: sarvam ced sukham iccheta sarva kāmān parityajet kāmām
translated: If one desires all happiness, one should give up all desires.

original: sarva kāma parityāgī hy atyantam sukham edhate //
analyzed: sarva kāma parityāgī hi atyantam sukham edhate
translated: For one who gives up all desires, indeed, attains the highest happiness.

original: yāvat kāmān anusaran na tṛptim manaso adhyagāt /
analyzed: yāvat kāmān anusaran na tṛptim manasaḥ adhyagāt
translated: As long as one pursues desires, one does not attain satisfaction of the mind.

original: tato nivṛttim pratipaśyamānās te vai tṛptāḥ prajñayā ye sutṛptāḥ //🔽śreyasī prajñayā tṛptir na hi kāmair vitṛpyate /
analyzed: tatas nivṛttim pratipaśyamānāḥ te vai tṛptāḥ prajñayā ye su tṛptāḥ  śreyasī prajñayā tṛptiḥ na hi kāmaiḥ vitṛpyate
translated: Therefore, those who see renunciation, they are truly satisfied with wisdom, being well-satisfied.🔽Satisfaction through wisdom is superior, for one is not satisfied with desires.

original: prajñayā puruṣam tṛptam tṛṣṇā na kurute vaśam //
analyzed: prajñayā puruṣam tṛptam tṛṣṇā na kurute vaśam
translated: Desire does not bring a man satisfied with wisdom under its control.

original: gṛddhā hi kāmeṣu narāḥ pramattā hy adharme bata te ratāḥ /
analyzed: gṛddhāḥ hi kāmeṣu narāḥ pramattāḥ hi adharme bata te ratāḥ
translated: Indeed, men attached to desires, being heedless, are devoted to unrighteousness.

original: antarāyam na te paśyanty alpake jīvite sati /🔽durmedhasam hanti bhogo na tv iha ātma gaveṣiṇam /
analyzed: antarāyam na te paśyanti alpake jīvite sati  durmedhasam hanti bhogaḥ na tu iha ātma gaveṣiṇam
translated: They do not see obstacles, when life is short.🔽Wealth destroys the unwise, not one who seeks the self here.

original: durmedhā bhoga tṛṣṇābhir hanty ātmānam atho parān //
analyzed: durmedhāḥ bhoga tṛṣṇābhiḥ hanti ātmānam atha u parān
translated: The unwise destroys himself and others through the craving for wealth and desires.

original: na karṣāpaṇa varṣeṇa tṛptiḥ kāmair hi vidyate /
analyzed: na karṣāpaṇa varṣeṇa tṛptiḥ kāmaiḥ hi vidyate
translated: One is not satisfied with sensual pleasures even with a rain of gold coins.

original: alpa āsvāda sukhāḥ kāmā /iti vijñāya paṇḍitaḥ //
analyzed: alpa āsvāda sukhāḥ kāmāiti vijñāya paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Sensual pleasures have little taste and are not pleasurable. Knowing this, the wise one

original: api divyeṣu kāmeṣu sa ratim na adhigacchati /
analyzed: api divyeṣu kāmeṣu sa ratim na adhigacchati
translated: does not find delight even in divine sensual pleasures.

original: tṛṣṇā kṣaya rato bhavati buddhānām śrāvakaḥ sadā //
analyzed: tṛṣṇā kṣaya rataḥ bhavati buddhānām śrāvakaḥ sadā
translated: The disciple of the Buddhas always finds delight in the destruction of craving.

original: parvato api suvarṇasya samo himavatā bhavet /
analyzed: parvataḥ api suvarṇasya samaḥ himavatā bhavet
translated: Even a mountain of gold could be equal to the Himalayas,

original: vittam tam nālam ekasya etaj jñātvā samam caret // vittam tam na alam ekasya
analyzed: vittam tam nālam ekasya etaj jñātvā samam caret vittam tam na alam ekasya
translated: but that wealth is not enough for one. Knowing this, one should act equally.

original: duhkham hi yo veda yato nidānam kāmeṣu jantu sa katham rameta /
analyzed: duhkham hi yaḥ veda yatas nidānam kāmeṣu jantu sa katham rameta
translated: For one who knows suffering to arise from sensual pleasures, how could a living being find delight in sensual pleasures?

original: upadhim hi loke śalyam iti matvā tasya eva dhīro vinayāya śikṣet //
analyzed: upadhim hi loke śalyam iti matvā tasya eva dhīraḥ vinayāya śikṣet
translated: Considering worldly attachment to be a dart, the wise one should train in order to remove it.

original: tṛṣṇāvarga
analyzed: tṛṣṇā varga
translated: Chapter on Craving

original: vitarka pramathitasya jantunas tīvra rāgasya śubha anudarśinaḥ /
analyzed: vitarka pramathitasya jantunaḥ tīvra rāgasya śubha anudarśinaḥ
translated: For a person crushed by discursive thoughts, with intense passion, perceiving beauty,

original: bhūyas tṛṣṇā pravardhate gāḍham hy eṣa karoti bandhanam //
analyzed: bhūyas tṛṣṇā pravardhate gāḍham hi eṣa karoti bandhanam
translated: craving increases greatly, for he creates strong bondage.

original: vitarka vyupaśame tu yo rato hy aśubham bhāvayate sadā smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vitarka vyupaśame tu yaḥ rataḥ hi aśubham bhāvayate sadā smṛtaḥ
translated: But one who delights in the pacification of discursive thoughts, always contemplating the unwholesome with mindfulness,

original: tṛṣṇā hy eṣa prahāsyate sa tu khalu pūti karoti bandhanam // eṣā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā hi eṣa prahāsyate sa tu khalu pūti karoti bandhanam eṣā
translated: This craving will be abandoned, but it is he who creates the foul bondage.

original: kāma andha jāla prakṣiptās tṛṣṇayā ācchāditāḥ prajāḥ /
analyzed: kāma andha jāla prakṣiptāḥ tṛṣṇayā ācchāditāḥ prajāḥ
translated: The people are thrown into the net of the blindness of desire, covered by craving,

original: pramattā bandhane baddhā matsyavat kupinā mukhe /
analyzed: pramattā bandhane baddhā matsya vat kupinā mukhe
translated: Careless, bound in bondage, like fish in a net, in the mouth of a crocodile.

original: jarā maraṇam āyānti vatsaḥ kṣīrapaka /iva mātaram //
analyzed: jarā maraṇam āyānti vatsaḥ kṣīrapakā eva mātaram
translated: Old age and death come to them, like a calf to its mother for milk.

original: manujasya pramatta cāriṇas tṛṣṇā vardhati mālutā iva hi / māluteva hi
analyzed: manujasya pramatta cāriṇaḥ tṛṣṇā vardhati mālutā iva hi mālutā iva hi
translated: For a man who acts carelessly, craving grows like a maluva creeper. Like a maluva creeper,

original: sa hi saṃsarate punaḥ punaḥ phalam icchann iva vānaro vane //🔽saritāni vai snehitāni vai saumanasyāni bhavanti jantunaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi saṃsarate punar punar phalam icchan iva vānaraḥ vane  saritāni vai snehitāni vai saumanasyāni bhavanti jantunaḥ
translated: He wanders again and again, like a monkey in the forest desiring fruit.🔽The rivers are affectionate, the joys are dear to the people.

original: ye sātasitāḥ sukha eṣiṇas te vai jāti jarā upagā narāḥ //
analyzed: ye sāta sitāḥ sukhe eṣiṇaḥ te vai jāti jarā upagāḥ narāḥ
translated: Those who are satisfied, seeking happiness, they are men who go to birth and old age.

original: tṛṣṇābhir upaskṛtāḥ prajāḥ paridhāvanti śaśā va vāgurām /
analyzed: tṛṣṇābhiḥ upaskṛtāḥ prajāḥ paridhāvanti śaśāḥ vaḥ vāgurām
translated: The people, served by craving, run around like rabbits in a trap.

original: samyojanaiḥ saṅga saktā duhkham yānti punaḥ punaś cira rātram //
analyzed: samyojanaiḥ saṅga saktā duhkham yānti punar punaś cira rātram
translated: Attached to the fetters of clinging, they go to suffering again and again for a long time.

original: tṛṣṇayā grathitāḥ sattvā rakta cittā bhavā bhave / satvā
analyzed: tṛṣṇayā grathitāḥ sattvāḥ rakta cittā bhavāḥ bhave
translated: Beings are bound by craving, their minds attached to existence in existence,

original: te yoga yukta māreṇa hy ayoga kṣemiṇo janāḥ /
analyzed: te yoga yukta māreṇa hi ayoga kṣemiṇaḥ janāḥ
translated: Those people who are engaged in yoga are not at ease, bound by Mara's yoga.

original: jarā maraṇam āyānti yogā hi duratikramāḥ //
analyzed: jarā maraṇam āyānti yogāḥ hi duratikramāḥ
translated: Old age and death come, for the bonds are hard to overcome.

original: yas tu tṛṣṇām prahāya iha vīta tṛṣṇo bhavā bhave /
analyzed: yaḥ tu tṛṣṇām prahāya iha vīta tṛṣṇaḥ bhava bhave
translated: But one who, in this world, renounces craving, and becomes free from craving in existence after existence,

original: tṛṣṇayā vibhavad bhikṣur anicchuḥ parinirvṛtaḥ //
analyzed: tṛṣṇayā vibhavat bhikṣuḥ anicchuḥ parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: That monk, free from craving, without desire, attains final Nirvāṇa.

original: ya /etām sahate grāmyām tṛṣṇām loke sudustyajām /
analyzed: yaetām sahate grāmyām tṛṣṇām loke sudustyajām
translated: One who endures this worldly craving, so hard to abandon in the world,

original: śokās tasya pravardhante hy avavṛṣṭā bīraṇā yathā //
analyzed: śokāḥ tasya pravardhante hi avavṛṣṭāḥ bīraṇāḥ yathā
translated: His sorrows increase, like reeds not watered.

original: yas tv etām tyajate grāmyām tṛṣṇām loke sudustyajām /
analyzed: yaḥ tu etām tyajate grāmyām tṛṣṇām loke su dustyajām
translated: But one who abandons this worldly craving, so hard to abandon in the world,

original: śokās tasya nivartante /uda bindur iva puṣkarāt //
analyzed: śokāḥ tasya nivartante uda binduḥ iva puṣkarāt
translated: His sorrows cease, like a drop of water on a lotus leaf.

original: tad vai vadāmi bhadram vo yāvantaḥ stha samāgatāḥ /
analyzed: tat vai vadāmi bhadram vaḥ yāvantaḥ stha samāgatāḥ
translated: I say this to you, all assembled here, for your own good:

original: tṛṣṇām samūlam khanata uśīra arthī iva bīraṇām /
analyzed: tṛṣṇām samūlam khanata uśīra arthī iva bīraṇām
translated: Dig up craving with its roots, like one seeking Uśīra grass.

original: tṛṣṇāyāḥ khāta mūlāyā na asti śokaḥ kuto bhayam //
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ khāta mūlāyāḥ na asti śokaḥ kutas bhayam
translated: For one who has dug up craving with its roots, there is no sorrow, how can there be fear?

original: tṛṣṇā dvitīyaḥ puruṣo dīrgham adhvānam āśayā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā dvitīyaḥ puruṣaḥ dīrgham adhvānam āśayā
translated: A man with craving as his second, travels a long path with hope.

original: punaḥ punaḥ saṃsarate garbham eti punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: punar punar saṃsarate garbham eti punar punar
translated: Again and again he transmigrates, enters a womb again and again.

original: ittham bhāva anyathī bhāvaḥ saṃsāre tv āgatim gatim //
analyzed: ittham bhāva anyathī bhāvaḥ saṃsāre tu āgatim gatim
translated: Thus, in this world, there is coming and going due to the change of existence.

original: tām tu tṛṣṇām prahāya iha vīta tṛṣṇo bhavā bhave /
analyzed: tām tu tṛṣṇām prahāya iha vīta tṛṣṇaḥ bhava bhave
translated: But one who, in this world, renounces that craving, and becomes free from craving in existence after existence,

original: na asau punaḥ saṃsarate tṛṣṇā hy asya na vidyate //
analyzed: na asau punar saṃsarate tṛṣṇā hi asya na vidyate
translated: He does not wander again, for he has no craving.

original: yayā devā manuṣyāś ca sitās tiṣṭhanti hārthikāḥ /
analyzed: yayā devāḥ manuṣyāḥ ca sitāḥ tiṣṭhanti hārthikāḥ
translated: By which gods and humans are bound, standing here with a desire for wealth.

original: tarata etām viṣaktikām kṣaṇo vo mā hy upatyagāt /
analyzed: tarataḥ etām viṣaktikām kṣaṇaḥ vaḥ mā hi upatyagāt
translated: Cross over this attachment, for the moment should not pass you by.

original: kṣaṇa atītā hi śocante narakeṣu samarpitāḥ //
analyzed: kṣaṇa atītāḥ hi śocante narakeṣu samarpitāḥ
translated: For those who have passed the moment grieve, being cast into the hells.

original: tṛṣṇā hi hetuḥ saritā viṣaktikā gaṇḍasya nityam visṛtā iha jālinī /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā hi hetuḥ saritā viṣaktikā gaṇḍasya nityam visṛtā iha jālinī
translated: Craving is the cause, the attachment, the net that is always spread here.

original: latām pipāsām apanīya sarvaśo nivartate duhkham idam punaḥ punaḥ //
analyzed: latām pipāsām apanīya sarvaśas nivartate duhkham idam punar punar
translated: Having completely removed the vine of thirst, this suffering ceases again and again.

original: yathā api mūlair anupadrutaiḥ sadā chinno api vṛkṣaḥ punar eva jāyate /
analyzed: yathā api mūlaiḥ anupadrutaiḥ sadā chinnaḥ api vṛkṣaḥ punar eva jāyate
translated: Just as a tree, even if cut down, grows again with its roots undisturbed,

original: evam hi tṛṣṇā anuśayair anuddhṛtair nirvartate duhkham idam punaḥ punaḥ //
analyzed: evam hi tṛṣṇā anuśayaiḥ an uddhṛtaiḥ nirvartate duhkham idam punar punar
translated: so this suffering arises again and again if the latent tendencies of craving are not uprooted.

original: yathā api śalyo dṛḍham ātmanā kṛtas tam eva hanyād balasā tv adhiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: yathā api śalyaḥ dṛḍham ātmanā kṛtaḥ tam eva hanyāt balasā tu adhiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Just as an arrow made by oneself, when shot, would strike oneself if controlled by force,

original: tathā tv iha ādhyātma samutthitā latās tṛṣṇā vadhāya upanayanti prāṇinām //
analyzed: tathā tu iha ādhyātma samutthitāḥ latāḥ tṛṣṇāḥ vadhāya upanayanti prāṇinām
translated: so in this case, the vines arising from within lead to the destruction of beings through craving.

original: etad ādīnavam jñātvā tṛṣṇā duhkhasya sambhavam /
analyzed: etat ādīnavam jñātvā tṛṣṇā duhkhasya sambhavam
translated: Having understood this danger, the origin of suffering through craving,

original: vīta tṛṣṇo hy anādānaḥ smṛto bhikṣuḥ parivrajet //
analyzed: vīta tṛṣṇaḥ hi anādānaḥ smṛtaḥ bhikṣuḥ parivrajet
translated: For a monk who has abandoned craving and does not grasp, who is mindful, should wander forth.

original: apramādavarga
analyzed: apramāda varga
translated: The Chapter on Vigilance

original: apramādo hy amṛta padam pramādo mṛtyunaḥ padam /
analyzed: apramādaḥ hi amṛta padam pramādaḥ mṛtyunaḥ padam
translated: Vigilance is the state of immortality, negligence is the state of death.

original: apramattā na ṃriyante ye pramattāḥ sadā mṛtāḥ //
analyzed: a pramattāḥ na ṃriyante ye pramattāḥ sadā mṛtāḥ
translated: The vigilant do not die, those who are always negligent are always dead.

original: etām viśeṣatām jñātvā hy apramādasya paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: etām viśeṣa tām jñātvā hi apramādasya paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Knowing this distinction, the wise one

original: apramādam pramudyeta nityam āryaḥ sva gocaram //🔽apramattāḥ sātatikā nityam dṛḍha parākramāḥ /
analyzed: apramādam pramudyeta nityam āryaḥ sva gocaram  apramattāḥ sātatikāḥ nityam dṛḍha parākramāḥ
translated: should rejoice in vigilance, the noble one always in his own domain.🔽The vigilant, the constant, always with firm resolve,

original: spṛśanti dhīrā nirvāṇam yoga kṣemam anuttaram //🔽pramādam apramādena yadā nudati paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: spṛśanti dhīrā nirvāṇam yoga kṣemam anuttaram  pramādam apramādena yadā nudati paṇḍitaḥ
translated: the wise ones touch nirvana, the unsurpassed security.🔽When the wise one repels negligence with vigilance,

original: prajñā prasādam āruhya tv aśokaḥ śokinīm prajām /
analyzed: prajñā prasādam āruhya tu aśokaḥ śokinīm prajām
translated: having ascended the clarity of wisdom, the sorrowless one, the people who are sorrowful,

original: parvatasthā eva bhūmisthān dhīro bālān avekṣate //
analyzed: parvata sthāḥ eva bhūmi sthān dhīraḥ bālān avekṣate
translated: the wise one, standing on the mountain, looks down on the foolish ones on the ground.

original: uttānena apramādena samyamena damena ca /
analyzed: uttānena apramādena samyamena damena ca
translated: With uplifted vigilance, with restraint and self-control,

original: dvīpam karoti medhāvī tam ogho na abhimardati //
analyzed: dvīpam karoti medhāvī tam oghaḥ na abhimardati
translated: the wise one makes an island, which the flood does not overwhelm.

original: utthānavataḥ smṛta ātmanaḥ śubha cittasya niśāmya cāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: utthānavataḥ smṛta ātmanaḥ śubha cittasya niśāmya cāriṇaḥ
translated: Of the one who is energetic, mindful, of good heart, and observes the conduct of the wise,

original: samyatasya hi dharma jīvino hy apramattasya yaśo abhivardhate //
analyzed: samyatasya hi dharma jīvinaḥ hi apramattasya yaśaḥ abhivardhate
translated: For the fame of one who is restrained, who lives righteously, and who is heedful, increases.

original: adhicetasi mā pramadyata pratatam mauna padeṣu śikṣata /
analyzed: adhicetasi mā pramadyata pratatam mauna padeṣu śikṣata
translated: Do not be heedless in your higher mind, always train in the states of silence.

original: śokā na bhavanti tāyino hy upaśāntasya sadā smṛta ātmanaḥ //
analyzed: śokāḥ na bhavanti tāyinaḥ hi upaśāntasya sadā smṛtaḥ ātmanaḥ
translated: For the one who is peaceful, always mindful of the self, there are no sorrows.

original: hīnām dharmām na seveta pramādena na saṃvaset /
analyzed: hīnām dharmām na seveta pramādena na saṃvaset
translated: One should not attend to inferior teachings, one should not associate with the heedless.

original: mithyā dṛṣṭim na roceta na bhavel loka vardhanaḥ //
analyzed: mithyā dṛṣṭim na roceta na bhavel loka vardhanaḥ
translated: One should not delight in wrong views, one should not be one who increases the world.

original: samyag dṛṣṭir adhīmātrā laukikī yasya vidyate /
analyzed: samyak dṛṣṭiḥ adhīmātrā laukikī yasya vidyate
translated: One who has the highest worldly right view

original: api jāti sahasrāṇi na asau gacchati durgatim //
analyzed: api jāti sahasrāṇi na asau gacchati durgatim
translated: even for thousands of lifetimes does not go to a bad rebirth.

original: pramādam anuvartante bālā durmedhaso janāḥ /
analyzed: pramādam anuvartante bālāḥ durmedhasaḥ janāḥ
translated: Foolish people of poor understanding follow heedlessness.

original: apramādam tu medhāvī dhanam śreṣṭhī iva rakṣati //
analyzed: apramādam tu medhāvī dhanam śreṣṭhī iva rakṣati
translated: But the wise one guards heedfulness as a merchant guards his wealth.

original: pramādam anuvartante bālā durmedhaso janāḥ /
analyzed: pramādam anuvartante bālāḥ durmedhasaḥ janāḥ
translated: Foolish people of poor understanding follow heedlessness.

original: apramattaḥ sadā dhyāyī prāpnute hy āsrava kṣayam //
analyzed: apramattaḥ sadā dhyāyī prāpnute hi āsrava kṣayam
translated: But the one who is always heedful and meditative attains the destruction of the defilements.

original: pramādam na anuyujyeta na kāma rati saṃstavam /
analyzed: pramādam na anuyujyeta na kāma rati saṃstavam
translated: One should not pursue heedlessness, nor delight in sensual pleasures.

original: apramattaḥ sadā dhyāyī prāpnute hy acalam sukham //
analyzed: apramattaḥ sadā dhyāyī prāpnute hi acalam sukham
translated: But the one who is always heedful and meditative attains unshakable happiness.

original: na ayam pramāda kālaḥ syād aprāpte hy āsrava kṣaye /
analyzed: na ayam pramāda kālaḥ syāt aprāpte hi āsrava kṣaye
translated: This is not the time for heedlessness, for the destruction of the defilements has not been attained.

original: māraḥ pramattam anveti siṃham vā mṛga mātṛkā //
analyzed: māraḥ pramattam anveti siṃham vā mṛga mātṛkā
translated: Mara follows the heedless one, like a tigress a lion.

original: sthānāni catvāri naraḥ pramatta /āpadyate yaḥ para dāra sevī /🔽apuṇya lābham hy anikāma śayyām nindām tṛtīyam narakam caturtham //
analyzed: sthānāni catvāri naraḥ pramatta āpadyate yaḥ para dāra sevī  apuṇya lābham hi anikāma śayyām nindām tṛtīyam narakam caturtham
translated: A man who is heedless and resorts to another's wife falls into four states:🔽Gaining demerit, an undesirable bed, blame, and thirdly hell as the fourth.

original: apuṇya lābham ca gatim ca pāpikām bhītasya bhītābhir atha alpikām ratim/
analyzed: apuṇya lābham ca gatim ca pāpikām bhītasya bhītābhiḥ atha alpikām ratim
translated: Gaining demerit, a bad destiny, and little fear-inspiring pleasure for the fearful,

original: nindām ca paśyan nwpateś ca daṇḍam parasya dārāṇi vivarjayeta //
analyzed: nindām ca paśyan nwpateḥ ca daṇḍam parasya dārāṇi vivarjayeta
translated: Seeing blame and the king's punishment, one should avoid another's wife.

original: apuṇya lābhaś ca gatiś ca pāpikā bhītasya bhītābhir atha alpikā ratiḥ /
analyzed: lābhaḥ ca gatiḥ ca pāpikā bhītasya bhītābhiḥ atha alpikā ratiḥ
translated: Gaining demerit, a bad destiny, and little fear-inspiring pleasure for the fearful,

original: rājā ca daṇḍam gurukam dadāti kāyasya bhedād narakeṣu paśyate //
analyzed: rājā ca daṇḍam gurukam dadāti kāyasya bhedāt narakeṣu paśyate
translated: The king imposes a heavy punishment, and after the body's dissolution one sees it in the hells.

original: pratiyatyā iva tat kuryād yaj jānedd hitam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: pratiyatyai iva tat kuryāt yat jānet hitam ātmanaḥ
translated: One should do what one knows to be beneficial for oneself, as if it were a debt to be repaid.

original: na śākaṭika cintābhir mandam dhīraḥ parākramet //🔽yathā śākaṭiko mārgam samam hitvā mahā patham /
analyzed: na śākaṭika cintābhiḥ mandam dhīraḥ parākramet  yathā śākaṭikaḥ mārgam samam hitvā mahā patham
translated: A wise person should not proceed slowly due to thoughts of a caravan.🔽Just as a caravan leader, leaving the even and good path,

original: viṣamam mārgam āgamya chinna akṣaḥ śocate bhṛśam //
analyzed: viṣamam mārgam āgamya chinna akṣaḥ śocate bhṛśam
translated: coming to an uneven path, grieves greatly due to the loss of his goods.

original: evam dharmād apakramya hy adharmam anuvartya ca /
analyzed: evam dharmāt apakramya hi adharmam anuvartya ca
translated: In this way, having strayed from Dharma and followed non-Dharma,

original: bālo mṛtyu vaśam prāptaś chinna akṣa /iva śocate //
analyzed: bālaḥ mṛtyu vaśam prāptaḥ chinna akṣā eva śocate
translated: the fool falls under the power of death, and grieves like one whose eyes have been gouged out.

original: yat kṛtyam tad apaviddham akṛtyam kriyate punaḥ /🔽uddhatānām pramattānām teṣām vardhanti /āsravāḥ /
analyzed: yat kṛtyam tad apaviddham akṛtyam kriyate punar  uddhatānām pramattānām teṣām vardhantiāsravāḥ
translated: What should be done is neglected, and what should not be done is done again.🔽For the arrogant and heedless, their defilements increase.

original: āsravās teṣu vardhante /ārāt te hy āsrava kṣayāt //
analyzed: āsravāḥ teṣu vardhante ārāt te hi āsrava kṣayāt
translated: Their defilements increase, for they are far from the destruction of defilements.

original: yeṣām tu susamārabdhā nityam kāya gatā smṛtiḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām tu susamārabdhā nityam kāya gatā smṛtiḥ
translated: But for those who have well undertaken mindfulness of the body at all times,

original: akṛtyam te na kurvanti kṛtye sātatya kāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: akṛtyam te na kurvanti kṛtye sātatya kāriṇaḥ
translated: they do not do what should not be done. They are constantly engaged in what should be done.

original: smṛtānām samprajānānām astam gacchanti āsravāḥ //
analyzed: smṛtānām samprajānānām astam gacchanti āsravāḥ
translated: For the mindful and fully aware, the defilements go to destruction.

original: na tāvatā dharma dharo yāvatā bahu bhāṣate /
analyzed: na tāvatā dharma dharaḥ yāvatā bahu bhāṣate
translated: One is not a Dharma holder merely by speaking much.

original: yas tv iha alpam api śrutvā dharmam kāyena vai spṛśet /
analyzed: yaḥ tu iha alpam api śrutvā dharmam kāyena vai spṛśet
translated: But one who, having heard the Dharma here, touches it with the body,

original: sa vai dharma dharo bhavati yo dharme na pramādyate //
analyzed: sa vai dharma dharaḥ bhavati yaḥ dharme na pramādyate
translated: he becomes a Dharma holder, who does not neglect the Dharma.

original: subahv api iha sahitam bhāṣamāṇo na tat karo bhavati naraḥ pramattaḥ /
analyzed: su bahu api iha sahitam bhāṣamāṇaḥ na tat karaḥ bhavati naraḥ pramattaḥ
translated: Even if one speaks much and well here, that person is not a doer if heedless.

original: gopā eva gāḥ saṃgaṇayan pareṣām na bhāgavān śrāmaṇya arthasya bhavati // bhāgavān śrāmaṇya arthasya
analyzed: gopāḥ eva gāḥ saṃgaṇayan pareṣām na bhāgavān śrāmaṇya arthasya bhavati bhāgavān śrāmaṇya arthasya
translated: The cowherds, counting the cows of others, are not entitled to the goal of recluseship. They are entitled to the goal of recluseship.

original: alpam api cet sahitam bhāṣamāṇo dharmasya bhavati hy anudharma cārī /
analyzed: alpam api ced sahitam bhāṣamāṇaḥ dharmasya bhavati hi anudharma cārī
translated: Even if one speaks little that is in accord with the Dharma, one becomes a practitioner of the Dharma.

original: rāgam ca doṣam ca tathaiva moham prahāya bhāgī śrāmaṇya arthasya bhavati //
analyzed: rāgam ca doṣam ca tathā eva moham prahāya bhāgī śrāmaṇya arthasya bhavati
translated: Abandoning passion, hatred, and delusion, one becomes entitled to the goal of recluseship.

original: apramādam praśaṃsanti pramādo garhitaḥ sadā /
analyzed: apramādam praśaṃsanti pramādaḥ garhitaḥ sadā
translated: They praise heedfulness, heedlessness is always condemned.

original: apramādena maghavān devānām śreṣṭhatām gataḥ //
analyzed: apramādena maghavān devānām śreṣṭha tām gataḥ
translated: Through heedfulness, Maghavan attained the highest position among the gods.

original: apramādam praśaṃsanti sadā kṛtyeṣu paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: apramādam praśaṃsanti sadā kṛtyeṣu paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise always praise heedfulness in all tasks.

original: apramatto hy ubhāv arthāv atigṛhṇāti paṇḍitaḥ //
analyzed: apramattaḥ hi ubhau arthau atigṛhṇāti paṇḍitaḥ
translated: For the heedful wise person attains both goals.

original: dṛṣṭa dhārmika /eko arthas tathā anyaḥ sāmparāyikaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa arthaḥ tathā anyaḥ sāmparāyikaḥ
translated: One goal is seen in this very life, and another is for the next world.

original: artha abhisamayād dhīraḥ paṇḍito hi nirucyate //
analyzed: artha abhisamayāt dhīraḥ paṇḍitaḥ hi nirucyate
translated: The wise one is indeed called learned because of his understanding of the goals.

original: apramāda rato bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda rataḥ bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ
translated: A monk who delights in heedfulness, who sees danger in heedlessness,

original: durgād uddharate tmānam paṅka sannaiva kuñjaraḥ // ātmānam paṅkasannaiva
analyzed: durgāt uddharate tmānam paṅka sannā eva kuñjaraḥ ātmānam paṅka sannā eva
translated: lifts himself out of misfortune, like an elephant from the mud.

original: apramāda rato bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda rataḥ bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ
translated: A monk who delights in heedfulness, who sees danger in heedlessness,

original: dhunāti pāpakām dharmām pattrāṇi iva hi mārutaḥ //
analyzed: dhunāti pāpakām dharmām pattrāṇi iva hi mārutaḥ
translated: Blows away bad qualities, like the wind blows away leaves.

original: apramāda rato bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda rataḥ bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ
translated: A monk who delights in heedfulness, who sees danger in heedlessness,

original: samyojanam aṇu sthūlam dahann agnir iva gacchati //
analyzed: samyojanam aṇu sthūlam dahan agniḥ iva gacchati
translated: Burning away the fetters, great and small, goes forth like a fire.

original: apramāda rato bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda rataḥ bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ
translated: A monk who delights in heedfulness, who sees danger in heedlessness,

original: spṛśati hy anupūrveṇa sarva samyojana kṣayam //
analyzed: spṛśati hi anupūrveṇa kṣayam
translated: Touches in due course the destruction of all the fetters.

original: apramāda rato bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda rataḥ bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ
translated: A monk who delights in heedfulness, who sees danger in heedlessness,

original: pratividhyate padam śāntam saṃskāra upaśamam sukham //
analyzed: pratividhyate padam śāntam saṃskāra upaśamam sukham
translated: Penetrates the peaceful state, the happiness of the stilling of conditioned things.

original: apramāda rato bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda rataḥ bhikṣuḥ pramāde bhaya darśakaḥ
translated: A monk who delights in heedfulness, who sees danger in heedlessness,

original: abhavyaḥ parihāṇāya nirvāṇasya eva so antike //
analyzed: abhavyaḥ parihāṇāya nirvāṇasya eva saḥ antike
translated: Is incapable of falling away, he is close to Nibbāna.

original: uttiṣṭhata vyāyamata dṛḍham śikṣata śāntaye /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhata vyāyamata dṛḍham śikṣata śāntaye
translated: Rise up, strive with firm resolve, train well for peace,

original: asmṛtiś ca pramādaś caiva anutthānam asamyamaḥ //
analyzed: asmṛtiḥ ca pramādaḥ ca eva anutthānam asamyamaḥ
translated: Lack of mindfulness, heedlessness, indolence, lack of restraint,

original: nidrā tandrīr anāyoga /ete śikṣā antarāyikāḥ /
analyzed: nidrā tandrīḥ anāyoga ete śikṣāḥ antarāyikāḥ
translated: Sleep, sloth, lack of application - these are obstacles to training.

original: tad aṅgam paribudhyadhvam smṛtir mā antar adhīyata //
analyzed: tat aṅgam paribudhyadhvam smṛtiḥ mā antar adhīyata
translated: Be aware of that, let not mindfulness be lost within you.

original: uttiṣṭhen na pramādyeta dharmam sucaritam caret /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhet na pramādyeta dharmam sucaritam caret
translated: One should rise up, not be heedless, practice the Dhamma well,

original: dharma cārī sukham śete hy asmiṃl loke paratra ca / asmim loke
analyzed: dharma cārī sukham śete hi asmin loke paratra ca asmim loke
translated: The one who practices the Dharma sleeps happily in this world and the next. In this world

original: apramāda ratā bhavata suśīlā bhavata bhikṣavaḥ /
analyzed: apramāda ratāḥ bhavata su śīlāḥ bhavata bhikṣavaḥ
translated: Be heedful, monks, be of good character.

original: susamāhita saṃkalpāḥ sva cittam anurakṣata //
analyzed: susamāhita saṃkalpāḥ sva cittam anurakṣata
translated: With well-concentrated intentions, guard your own mind.

original: ārabhadhvam niṣkramadhvam yujyadhvam buddha śāsane /
analyzed: ārabhadhvam niṣkramadhvam yujyadhvam buddha śāsane
translated: Strive, go forth, apply yourselves to the Buddha's teaching.

original: dhunidhvam mṛtyunaḥ sainyam naḍāgāram iva kuñjaraḥ // naḍa agāram
analyzed: dhunidhvam mṛtyunaḥ sainyam naḍāgāram iva kuñjaraḥ naḍa agāram
translated: Shake off the army of death like an elephant shakes off a hut of reeds.

original: yo hy asmin dharma vinaye tv apramatto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi asmin dharma vinaye tu apramattaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For one who is heedful in this Dharma and Vinaya,

original: prahāya jāti saṃsāram duhkhasya antam sa yāsyati //
analyzed: prahāya jāti saṃsāram duhkhasya antam sa yāsyati
translated: Having abandoned the cycle of birth, he will go to the end of suffering.

original: priyavarga
analyzed: priyavarga
translated: The Chapter on the Beloved

original: priyebhyo jāyate śokaḥ priyebhyo jāyate bhayam /
analyzed: priyebhyaḥ jāyate śokaḥ priyebhyaḥ jāyate bhayam
translated: From the beloved arises sorrow, from the beloved arises fear.

original: priyebhyo vipramuktānām na asti śokaḥ kuto bhayam //
analyzed: priyebhyaḥ vipramuktānām na asti śokaḥ kutas bhayam
translated: For those who are free from the beloved, there is no sorrow, how much less fear?

original: priyebhyo jāyate śokaḥ priyebhyo jāyate bhayam /
analyzed: priyebhyaḥ jāyate śokaḥ priyebhyaḥ jāyate bhayam
translated: From the beloved arises sorrow, from the beloved arises fear.

original: priyāṇām anyathī bhāvād unmādam api gacchati //
analyzed: priyāṇām anyathī bhāvāt unmādam api gacchati
translated: Due to the transformation of the beloved, one even goes mad.

original: śokā hi ye vai paridevitam ca duhkham ca lokasya hi naikarūpam /
analyzed: śokāḥ hi ye vai paridevitam ca duhkham ca lokasya hi na ekarūpam
translated: For sorrows are indeed lamentations, and suffering in the world is not of one kind.

original: priyam pratītya iha tad asti sarvam priye asati syān na kathaṃcid etat //
analyzed: priyam pratītya iha tat asti sarvam priye asati syāt na kathaṃcid etat
translated: All this exists here in dependence on what is dear. If there is nothing dear, this would not exist in any way.

original: tasmādd hi te sukhitā vīta śokā yeṣām priyam na asti kathaṃcid eva /
analyzed: tasmāt hi te sukhitāḥ vīta śokāḥ yeṣām priyam na asti kathaṃcid eva
translated: Therefore, they are happy and free from sorrow, those for whom there is nothing dear in any way.

original: tasmād aśokam padam eṣamāṇaḥ priyam na kurvīta hi jīva loke //
analyzed: tasmāt aśokam padam eṣamāṇaḥ priyam na kurvīta hi jīva loke
translated: Therefore, one who seeks the sorrowless state should not do what is dear in the world of the living.

original: mā priyaiḥ saṃgamo jātu mā ca syād apriyaiḥ sadā /
analyzed: mā priyaiḥ saṃgamaḥ jātu mā ca syāt apriyaiḥ sadā
translated: Let there never be union with the dear ones, nor with the hateful ones.

original: priyāṇām adarśanam duhkham apriyāṇām ca dharśanam //
analyzed: priyāṇām adarśanam duhkham apriyāṇām ca dharśanam
translated: The non-seeing of the dear ones is sorrow, and the seeing of the hateful ones.

original: priyāṇām ca vinā bhāvād apriyāṇām ca saṃgamāt /
analyzed: priyāṇām ca vinā bhāvāt apriyāṇām ca saṃgamāt
translated: From the separation of the dear ones and the union with the hateful ones,

original: tīvra /utpadyate śoko jīryante yena mānavāḥ //
analyzed: tīvraḥ utpadyate śokaḥ jīryante yena mānavāḥ
translated: intense sorrow arises, by which men decay.

original: priyam mṛtam kāla gatam jñātayaḥ sahitāḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: priyam mṛtam kāla gatam jñātayaḥ sahitāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: The relatives of a dear one who has died and passed away are gathered together.

original: śocanti dīrgham adhvānam duhkho hi priya saṃgamaḥ //
analyzed: śocanti dīrgham adhvānam duhkhaḥ hi priya saṃgamaḥ
translated: They grieve for a long time. For sorrow arises from the union with the dear ones.

original: tasmāt priyam na kurvīta priya bhāvo hi pāpakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt priyam na kurvīta priya bhāvaḥ hi pāpakaḥ
translated: Therefore, one should not do what is dear, for the state of being dear is sinful.

original: granthās teṣām na vidyante yeṣām na asti priya apriyam /
analyzed: granthāḥ teṣām na vidyante yeṣām na asti priya apriyam
translated: Those who have no dear ones and hateful ones have no knots.

original: ayuge yujya ca ātmānam yuge ca ayujya sarvadā /
analyzed: ayuge yujya ca ātmānam yuge ca ayujya sarvadā
translated: One should yoke oneself at the wrong time and always unyoke at the right time.

original: artham hitvā priya grāhī spṛhayaty artha yogine //
analyzed: artham hitvā priya grāhī spṛhayati artha yogine
translated: Having abandoned wealth, he is attached to what is pleasing, and longs for union with wealth.

original: priya rūpa sāta grathitā deva kāyāḥ pṛthak sthitāḥ /
analyzed: priya rūpa sāta grathitā deva kāyāḥ pṛthak sthitāḥ
translated: The bodies of gods, bound by the pleasure of form, are separate.

original: āghādinaḥ paridyūnā mṛtyu rāja vaśam gatāḥ //
analyzed: āghādinaḥ paridyūnā mṛtyu rāja vaśam gatāḥ
translated: They are devoured, afflicted, and come under the power of the king of death.

original: ye vai divā ca rātrau caiva /apramattāḥ priyam jahati nityam /
analyzed: ye vai divā ca rātrau ca eva apramattāḥ priyam jahati nityam
translated: Those who, day and night, are not heedful, always abandon what is dear,

original: te vai khananti tv agha mūlam mṛtyurāmiṣam durativartyam //
analyzed: te vai khananti tu agha mūlam mṛtyuḥ āmiṣam durativartyam
translated: They dig up the root of evil, the food of death, which is difficult to overcome.

original: asādhu sādhu rūpeṇa priya rūpeṇa ca apriyam /
analyzed: asādhu sādhu rūpeṇa priya rūpeṇa ca apriyam
translated: What is unwholesome in the form of what is wholesome, and what is unpleasant in the form of what is pleasant,

original: duhkham sukhasya rūpeṇa pramattān abhimardati //
analyzed: duhkham sukhasya rūpeṇa pramattān abhimardati
translated: Pain, in the form of pleasure, oppresses the heedless.

original: ātmānam cet priyam vidyān na enam pāpena yojayet /
analyzed: ātmānam ced priyam vidyāt na enam pāpena yojayet
translated: If one knows oneself to be dear, one should not connect oneself with evil,

original: na hy etat sulabham bhavati sukham duṣkṛta kāriṇā //
analyzed: na hi etat sulabham bhavati sukham duṣkṛta kāriṇā
translated: For this happiness is not easy to attain for one who does evil.

original: ātmānam cet priyam vidyān na enam pāpena yojayet /
analyzed: ātmānam ced priyam vidyāt na enam pāpena yojayet
translated: If one knows oneself to be dear, one should not connect oneself with evil,

original: etadd hi sulabham bhavati sukham sukṛta kāriṇā //
analyzed: etadd hi sulabham bhavati sukham sukṛta kāriṇā
translated: For this happiness is easy to attain for one who does good.

original: ātmānam cet priyam vidyād rakṣed enam surakṣitam /
analyzed: ātmānam ced priyam vidyāt rakṣet enam su rakṣitam
translated: If one knows oneself to be dear, one should guard oneself well,

original: yathā pratyanta nagaram gambhīra parikham dṛḍham /
analyzed: yathā pratyanta nagaram gambhīra parikham dṛḍham
translated: Just as one would a frontier town, deep-moated and strongly built.

original: trayāṇām anyatamam yāmam pratijāgreta paṇḍitaḥ //
analyzed: trayāṇām anyatamam yāmam pratijāgreta paṇḍitaḥ
translated: The wise one should keep watch over one of the three, namely, Yama.

original: ātmānam cet priyam vidyād gopayet tam sugopitam /
analyzed: ātmānam ced priyam vidyāt gopayet tam sugopitam
translated: If one knows that one's self is dear, one should guard it well.

original: yathā pratyanta nagaram guptam antar bahisthiram / antar bahiḥ sthiram
analyzed: yathā pratyanta nagaram guptam antar bahisthiram antar bahis sthiram
translated: Just as a border town is guarded, firm within and without,

original: evam gopayata ātmānam kṣaṇo vo mā hy upatyagāt /
analyzed: evam gopayataḥ ātmānam kṣaṇaḥ vaḥ mā hi upatyagāt
translated: so should one guard oneself. Let not the moment come upon you.

original: kṣaṇa atītā hi śocante narakeṣu samarpitāḥ //
analyzed: kṣaṇa atītāḥ hi śocante narakeṣu samarpitāḥ
translated: For those who have missed the moment grieve, being cast into the hells.

original: sarvā diśas tv anuparigamya cetasā na eva adhyagāt priyataram ātmanaḥ kvacit /
analyzed: sarvāḥ diśaḥ tu anuparigamya cetasā naḥ eva adhyagāt priyataram ātmanaḥ kvacid
translated: Having gone around in all directions with the mind, he did not find anywhere a self more dear than one's own.

original: evam priyaḥ pṛthag ātmā pareṣām tasmān na hiṃsyāt param ātma kāraṇam //
analyzed: evam priyaḥ pṛthag ātmā pareṣām tasmāt na hiṃsyāt param ātma kāraṇam
translated: Thus, one's own self is dear to others. Therefore, one should not harm another for one's own sake.

original: sarve daṇḍasya bibhyanti sarveṣām jīvitam priyam /
analyzed: sarve daṇḍasya bibhyanti sarveṣām jīvitam priyam
translated: All fear the rod. Life is dear to all.

original: ātmānam upamām kṛtvā na eva hanyān na ghātayet //🔽cira pravāsinam yadvad dūrataḥ svastinā āgatam /
analyzed: ātmānam upamām kṛtvā na eva hanyāt na ghātayet  cira pravāsinam yadvat dūratas svastinā āgatam
translated: Having made oneself the example, one should neither kill nor cause to kill.🔽Just as relatives, friends and allies rejoice at the safe return of one who has been away for a long time,

original: jñātayaḥ suhṛdo mitrāś ca abhinandanti āgatam //
analyzed: jñātayaḥ suhṛdaḥ mitrāḥ ca abhinandanti āgatam
translated: having come from afar,🔽in the same way, when a mortal who has done good deeds passes from this world

original: kṛta puṇyam tathā martyam asmāṃl lokāt param gatam / asmāl lokāt
analyzed: kṛta puṇyam tathā martyam asmān lokāt param gatam asmāt lokāt
translated: to the next world,

original: puṇyāny eva abhinandanti priyam jñātim iva āgatam //🔽tasmāt kuruta puṇyānām nicayam sāmparāyikam /
analyzed: puṇyāni eva abhinandanti priyam jñātim iva āgatam  tasmāt kuruta puṇyānām nicayam sāmparāyikam
translated: They rejoice in merit, as if it were a dear relative come to them.🔽Therefore, make a store of merit for the next world.

original: puṇyāni para loke hi pratiṣṭhā prāṇinām hi sā //
analyzed: puṇyāni para loke hi pratiṣṭhā prāṇinām hi sā
translated: For merit is the support of living beings in the next world.

original: puṇyam devāḥ praśaṃsanti sama caryām ca yaś caret /
analyzed: puṇyam devāḥ praśaṃsanti sama caryām ca yaḥ caret
translated: The gods praise merit, and one should practice impartiality.

original: iha ca anindito bhavati pretya svarge ca modate //
analyzed: iha ca aninditaḥ bhavati pretya svarge ca modate
translated: Here one becomes irreproachable, and hereafter one rejoices in heaven.

original: dharmastham śīla sampannam hrīmantam satya vādinam /🔽ātmanaḥ kārakam santam tam janaḥ kurute priyam //
analyzed: dharmastham śīla sampannam hrīmantam satya vādinam  ātmanaḥ kārakam santam tam janaḥ kurute priyam
translated: One who is established in dharma, endowed with good conduct, modest, truthful,🔽and self-controlled, that person is made dear by others.

original: pareṣām ca priyo bhavati hy ātma artham kriyate api ca /
analyzed: pareṣām ca priyaḥ bhavati hi ātma artham kriyate api ca
translated: And one becomes dear to others, and one's own purpose is accomplished.

original: dṛṣṭe ca dharme prāśaṃsyaḥ sāmparāye ca sad gatiḥ //
analyzed: dṛṣṭe ca dharme prāśaṃsyaḥ sāmparāye ca sat gatiḥ
translated: In this life one is praised, and in the next life one goes to a good destination.

original: avavadeta anuśāsīta ca asabhyāc ca nivārayet /
analyzed: avavadeta anuśāsīta ca asabhyāt ca nivārayet
translated: One should admonish and instruct, and turn away from the unrighteous.

original: asatām na priyo bhavati satām bhavati tu priyaḥ //
analyzed: asatām na priyaḥ bhavati satām bhavati tu priyaḥ
translated: One does not become dear to the unrighteous, but one becomes dear to the righteous.

original: asantaś caiva santaś ca nānā yānti tv itaś cyutāḥ /
analyzed: asantaḥ ca eva santaḥ ca nānā yānti tu itas cyutāḥ
translated: The unrighteous and the righteous go to different places after falling from here.

original: asanto narakam yānti santaḥ svarga parāyaṇāḥ //🔽śīlavarga
analyzed: asantaḥ narakam yānti santaḥ svarga parāyaṇāḥ 🔽śīla varga
translated: The unrighteous go to hell, the righteous are devoted to heaven.

original: śīlam rakṣeta medhāvī prārthayan vai sukha trayam / prārthayaṃ
analyzed: śīlam rakṣeta medhāvī prārthayan vai sukha trayam prārthayaṃ
translated: The wise one who seeks the three kinds of happiness should guard morality,

original: praśaṃsā vitta lābham ca pretya svarge ca modanam //
analyzed: praśaṃsā vitta lābham ca pretya svarge ca modanam
translated: seeking praise, wealth, and after death, joy in heaven.

original: sthānāny etāni sampaśyan śīlam rakṣeta paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: sthānāni etāni sampaśyan śīlam rakṣeta paṇḍitaḥ
translated: The wise one should guard morality, seeing these as its benefits.

original: āryo darśana sampannaḥ sa loke labhate śivam //
analyzed: āryaḥ darśana sampannaḥ sa loke labhate śivam
translated: The noble one, endowed with insight, finds peace in the world.

original: sukham śīla samādānam kāyo na paridahyate /
analyzed: sukham śīla samādānam kāyaḥ na paridahyate
translated: The undertaking of morality is happiness, the body does not burn.

original: sukham ca rātrau svapati pratibhuddhaś ca nandati //
analyzed: sukham ca rātrau svapati pratibhuddhaḥ ca nandati
translated: And one sleeps happily at night, and awakes joyful.

original: śīlam yāvaj jarā sādhu śraddhā sādhu pratiṣṭhitā /
analyzed: śīlam yāvat jarā sādhu śraddhā sādhu pratiṣṭhitā
translated: Morality is good until old age, faith is well-established.

original: prajñā narāṇām ratnam vai puṇyam coraiḥ sudurharam //
analyzed: prajñā narāṇām ratnam vai puṇyam coraiḥ sudurharam
translated: Wisdom is the jewel of men, merit is difficult for thieves to carry off.

original: kṛtvā puṇyāni saprajño dattvā dānāni śīlavān / datvā
analyzed: kṛtvā puṇyāni sa prajñaḥ dattvā dānāni śīlavān da tvā
translated: Having performed meritorious deeds, being wise, having given gifts, being moral,

original: iha ca atha paratra asau sukham samadhigacchati //
analyzed: iha ca atha paratra asau sukham samadhigacchati
translated: here and in the next world, he attains happiness.

original: śīle pratiṣṭhito bhikṣur indriyaiś ca susaṃvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: śīle pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhikṣuḥ indriyaiḥ ca su saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: A monk established in morality, well-restrained by the faculties,

original: bhojane ca api mātrajño yukto jāgarikāsu ca //
analyzed: bhojane ca api mātra jñaḥ yuktaḥ jāgarikāsu ca
translated: knowing moderation in food, devoted to wakefulness,

original: viharann evam ātāpī hy aho rātram atandritaḥ /
analyzed: viharan evam ātāpī hi ahar rātram atandritaḥ
translated: dwelling thus, ardent, day and night, heedful,

original: abhavyaḥ parihāṇāya nirvāṇasya eva so antike //
analyzed: abhavyaḥ parihāṇāya nirvāṇasya eva saḥ antike
translated: is not subject to falling away, and is close to nirvana.

original: śīle pratiṣṭhito bhikṣuś cittam prajñām ca bhāvayet /
analyzed: śīle pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhikṣuḥ cittam prajñām ca bhāvayet
translated: A monk who is established in morality should develop his mind and wisdom,

original: ātāpī nipako nityam prāpnuyād duhkha saṃkṣayam //
analyzed: ātāpī nipakaḥ nityam prāpnuyāt duhkha saṃkṣayam
translated: being energetic and mindful at all times, he will attain the end of suffering.

original: tasmāt satata śīlī syāt samādher anurakṣakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt satata śīlī syāt samādheḥ anurakṣakaḥ
translated: Therefore, one should always be moral, a protector of concentration,

original: vipaśyanāyām śikṣec ca samprajāna pratismṛtaḥ //🔽sa tu vikṣīṇa samyogaḥ kṣīṇa māno niraupadhiḥ /
analyzed: vipaśyanāyām śikṣet ca samprajāna pratismṛtaḥ  sa tu vikṣīṇa samyogaḥ kṣīṇa mānaḥ niraupadhiḥ
translated: and train in insight, being fully aware and mindful.🔽He whose fetters are destroyed, whose pride is destroyed, who is without conceit,

original: kāyasya bhedat saprajñaḥ saṃkhyān na upaiti nirvṛtaḥ //
analyzed: kāyasya bhedat saprajñaḥ saṃkhyān na upaiti nirvṛtaḥ
translated: that wise one, with the destruction of the body, does not return to existence and attains nirvana.

original: śīlam samādhiḥ prajñā ca yasya hy ete subhāvitāḥ /🔽so atyanta niṣṭho vimalas tv aśokaḥ kṣīṇa sambhavaḥ //
analyzed: śīlam samādhiḥ prajñā ca yasya hi ete su bhāvitāḥ  saḥ atyanta niṣṭhaḥ vimalaḥ tu aśokaḥ kṣīṇa sambhavaḥ
translated: For whom these are well-developed: morality, concentration, and wisdom,🔽he is utterly fulfilled, stainless, sorrowless, with existence destroyed.

original: saṅgāt pramukto hy asita /ājñātāvī niraupadhiḥ /
analyzed: saṅgāt pramuktaḥ hi asita ājñātāvī niraupadhiḥ
translated: Freed from attachment, dark, fully aware, without conceit,

original: atikramya māra viṣayam ādityo vā virocate //
analyzed: atikramya māra viṣayam ādityaḥ vā virocate
translated: having transcended the realm of Mara, he shines like the sun.

original: uddhatasya pramattasya bhikṣuṇo bahir ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: uddhatasya pramattasya bhikṣuṇaḥ bahis ātmanaḥ
translated: For a monk who is excited and heedless, who is external to himself,

original: śīlam samādhiḥ prajñā ca pāripūrim na gacchati //
analyzed: śīlam samādhiḥ prajñā ca pāripūrim na gacchati
translated: morality, concentration, and wisdom do not reach completion.

original: channam eva abhivarṣati vivṛtam na abhivarṣati /
analyzed: channam eva abhivarṣati vivṛtam na abhivarṣati
translated: It rains only on what is covered, not on what is uncovered.

original: tasmādd hi channam vivared evam tam na abhivarṣati // cchannam
analyzed: tasmāt hi channam vivaret evam tam na abhivarṣati channam
translated: Therefore, one should open up what is hidden, so that it does not rain on it.

original: etadd hi dṛṣṭvā śikṣeta sadā śīleṣu paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: etat hi dṛṣṭvā śikṣeta sadā śīleṣu paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Having seen this, the wise one should always train in morality.

original: nirvāṇa gamanam mārgam kṣipram eva viśodhayet //
analyzed: nirvāṇa gamanam mārgam kṣipram eva viśodhayet
translated: One should quickly purify the path leading to nirvana.

original: na puṣpa gandhaḥ prativātam eti na vāhnijāt tagarāc candanād vā /
analyzed: na puṣpa gandhaḥ prativātam eti na vā ahni jāt tagarāt candanāt vā
translated: The fragrance of flowers does not go against the wind, nor does the fragrance of tagara or sandalwood born of fire.

original: satām tu gandhaḥ prativātam eti sarvā diśaḥ sat puruṣaḥ pravāti //
analyzed: satām tu gandhaḥ prativātam eti sarvā diśaḥ sat puruṣaḥ pravāti
translated: But the fragrance of the virtuous goes against the wind, a good person spreads fragrance in all directions.

original: tagarāc candanāc ca api vārṣikāyās tathā utpalāt /
analyzed: tagarāt candanāt ca api vārṣikāyāḥ tathā utpalāt
translated: Tagara, sandalwood, monsoon jasmine, and blue lotus -

original: etebhyo gandha jātebhyaḥ śīla gandhas tv anuttaraḥ //
analyzed: etebhyaḥ gandha jātebhyaḥ śīla gandhaḥ tu anuttaraḥ
translated: Among all these fragrant substances, the fragrance of morality is unsurpassed.

original: alpa mātro hy ayam gandho yo ayam tagara candanāt /
analyzed: alpa mātraḥ hi ayam gandhaḥ yaḥ ayam tagara candanāt
translated: This fragrance of tagara and sandalwood is only a little bit,

original: yas tu śīlavatām gandho vāti deveṣv api iha saḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu śīlavatām gandhaḥ vāti deveṣu api iha saḥ
translated: But the fragrance of those who possess morality spreads even among the gods.

original: teṣām viśuddha śīlānām apramāda vihāriṇām /
analyzed: teṣām viśuddha śīlānām apramāda vihāriṇām
translated: For those of pure morality, who dwell heedfully,

original: samyag ājñā vimuktānām māro mārgam na vindati //
analyzed: samyak ājñā vimuktānām māraḥ mārgam na vindati
translated: Those who are liberated through right knowledge, Mara cannot find a way.

original: eṣa kṣema gamo mārga /eṣa mārgo viśuddhaye /
analyzed: eṣa kṣema gamaḥ mārgaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ viśuddhaye
translated: This is the path to safety, this is the path to purification.

original: pratipannakāḥ prahāsyanti dhyāyino māra bandhanam //
analyzed: pratipannakāḥ prahāsyanti dhyāyinaḥ māra bandhanam
translated: Those who have entered the path will abandon the bondage of Mara while meditating.

original: sucaritavarga
analyzed: su carita varga
translated: Chapter on Good Conduct

original: kāya pradoṣam rakṣeta syāt kāyena susaṃvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kāya pradoṣam rakṣeta syāt kāyena susaṃvṛtaḥ
translated: One should guard against bodily faults, and be well restrained in body.

original: kāya duścaritam hitvā kāyena sukṛtam caret //🔽vācaḥ pradoṣam rakṣeta vacasā saṃvṛto bhavet /
analyzed: kāya duścaritam hitvā kāyena sukṛtam caret  vācaḥ pradoṣam rakṣeta vacasā saṃvṛtaḥ bhavet
translated: Abandoning bodily misconduct, one should practice good conduct with the body.🔽One should guard against verbal faults, and be restrained in speech.

original: vāco duścaritam hitvā vācā sucaritam caret //🔽manaḥ pradoṣam rakṣeta manasā saṃvṛto bhavet /
analyzed: vācaḥ duścaritam hitvā vācā su caritam caret  manaḥ pradoṣam rakṣeta manasā saṃvṛtaḥ bhavet
translated: Abandoning verbal misconduct, one should practice good conduct with speech.🔽One should guard against mental faults, and be restrained in mind.

original: mano duścaritam hitvā manaḥ sucaritam caret //
analyzed: manaḥ duścaritam hitvā manaḥ sucaritam caret
translated: Abandoning mental misconduct, one should practice good conduct with the mind.

original: kāya duścaritam hitvā vaco duścaritāni ca /
analyzed: kāya duścaritam hitvā vacaḥ duścaritāni ca
translated: Abandoning bodily misconduct, and verbal misconduct,

original: mano duścaritam hitvā yac ca anyad doṣa saṃhitam //
analyzed: manaḥ duścaritam hitvā yat ca anyat doṣa saṃhitam
translated: and mental misconduct, and whatever else is faulty,

original: kāyena kuśalam kuryād vacasā kuśalam bahu /
analyzed: kāyena kuśalam kuryāt vacasā kuśalam bahu
translated: One should do what is skillful with the body, and much what is skillful with speech,

original: manasā kuśalam kuryād apramāṇam niraupadhim //
analyzed: manasā kuśalam kuryāt apramāṇam niraupadhim
translated: and what is skillful with the mind, immeasurable and unselfish.

original: kāyena kuśalam kṛtvā vacasā cetasā api ca /
analyzed: kāyena kuśalam kṛtvā vacasā cetasā api ca
translated: Having done what is skillful with the body, and with speech and mind as well,

original: iha ca atha paratra asau sukham samadhigacchati //
analyzed: iha ca atha paratra asau sukham samadhigacchati
translated: Here and in the next world, he attains happiness.

original: ahiṃsakā vai munayo nityam kāyena saṃvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ahiṃsakāḥ vai munayaḥ nityam kāyena saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: The sages, who are non-violent, are always well restrained in body.

original: te yānti hy acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati //
analyzed: te yānti hi acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati
translated: They go to the imperishable state, having gone to which one does not grieve.

original: ahiṃsakā vai munayo nityam vācā susaṃvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ahiṃsakāḥ vai munayaḥ nityam vācā su saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: The sages, who are non-violent, are always well restrained in speech.

original: te yānti hy acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati //
analyzed: te yānti hi acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati
translated: They go to the imperishable state, having gone to which one does not grieve.

original: ahiṃsakā vai munayo manasā nitya saṃvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ahiṃsakāḥ vai munayaḥ manasā nitya saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: The sages who are non-violent, always restrained in mind,

original: te yānti hy acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati //
analyzed: te yānti hi acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati
translated: they go to the imperishable state, having gone to which one does not grieve.

original: kāyena saṃvṛtā dhīrā dhīrā vācā susaṃvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: kāyena saṃvṛtāḥ dhīrāḥ dhīrāḥ vācā su saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: The wise are restrained in body, the wise are well-restrained in speech,

original: manasā saṃvṛtā dhīrā dhīrāḥ sarvatra saṃvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: manasā saṃvṛtāḥ dhīrāḥ dhīrāḥ sarvatra saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: the wise are restrained in mind, the wise are restrained everywhere.

original: te yānti hy acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati //
analyzed: te yānti hi acyutam sthānam yatra gatvā na śocati
translated: They go to the imperishable state, having gone to which one does not grieve.

original: kāyena saṃvaraḥ sādhu sādhu vācā ca saṃvaraḥ /
analyzed: kāyena saṃvaraḥ sādhu sādhu vācā ca saṃvaraḥ
translated: Restraint in body is good, restraint in speech is good,

original: manasā saṃvaraḥ sādhu sādhu sarvatra saṃvaraḥ /
analyzed: manasā saṃvaraḥ sādhu sādhu sarvatra saṃvaraḥ
translated: restraint in mind is good, restraint everywhere is good.

original: sarvatra saṃvṛto bhikṣuḥ sarva duhkhāt pramucyate //
analyzed: sarvatra saṃvṛtaḥ bhikṣuḥ sarva duhkhāt pramucyate
translated: The monk who is restrained everywhere is freed from all suffering.

original: vācā anurakṣī manasā susaṃvṛtaḥ kāyena caiva akuśalam na kuryāt /
analyzed: vācā anurakṣī manasā su saṃvṛtaḥ kāyena ca eva akuśalam na kuryāt
translated: One who guards speech, well-restrained in mind, and does not do evil even with the body,

original: etām śubhām karma pathām viśodhayann ārādhayen mārgam ṛṣi praveditam //
analyzed: etām śubhām karma pathām viśodhayan ārādhayet mārgam ṛṣi praveditam
translated: purifying this auspicious path of action, should practice the path taught by the sages.

original: vācavarga
analyzed: vāca varga
translated: Chapter on Speech

original: abhūta vādī narakān upaiti yaś ca anyad apy ācarati iha karma /
analyzed: abhūta vādī narakān upaiti yaḥ ca anyat api ācarati iha karma
translated: One who speaks falsely goes to hell, and one who performs other actions here,

original: ubhau hi tau pretya samau niruktau nihīna dharmau manujau paratra //
analyzed: ubhau hi tau pretya samau niruktau nihīna dharmau manujau paratra
translated: For both of them, after death, are declared to be equal, those two men of low morality.

original: puruṣasya hi jātasya kuṭhārī jāyate mukhe /
analyzed: puruṣasya hi jātasya kuṭhārī jāyate mukhe
translated: For a man who is born, an axe is born in his mouth,

original: yayā chinatti ha ātmānam vācā durbhāṣitam vadan //
analyzed: yayā chinatti ha ātmānam vācā durbhāṣitam vadan
translated: By which he cuts himself, speaking with the voice evil words.

original: yo nindiyām praśaṃsati tān api nindati ye praśaṃsiyāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ nindiyām praśaṃsati tān api nindati ye praśaṃsiyāḥ
translated: He who praises those who are to be blamed and blames those who are to be praised,

original: sa cinoti mukhena tam kalim kalinā tena sukham na vindati //
analyzed: sa cinoti mukhena tam kalim kalinā tena sukham na vindati
translated: He gathers that quarrel in his mouth, by that quarrel he does not find happiness.

original: alpa mātro hy ayam kalir ya /ihha akṣeṇa dhanam parājayet /
analyzed: alpa mātraḥ hi ayam kaliḥ yaihha akṣeṇa dhanam parājayet
translated: For this quarrel is small, in which one would lose wealth with dice here.

original: ayam atra mahattaraḥ kalir yaḥ sugateṣu manaḥ pradūṣayet //
analyzed: ayam atra mahattaraḥ kaliḥ yaḥ sugateṣu manaḥ pradūṣayet
translated: But this is the greater quarrel here, in which one would defile the mind towards the Fortunate Ones.

original: śatam sahasrāṇi nirarbudāni ṣaṭ triṃśatim pañca tathā arbudāni /🔽yān ārya garhī narakān upaiti vācam manaś ca praṇidhāya pāpakam //🔽asatam hi vadanti pāpa cittā narakam vardhayate vadhāya nityam /
analyzed: śatam sahasrāṇi nirarbudāni ṣaṭ triṃśatim pañca tathā arbudāni  yān ārya garhī narakān upaiti vācam manaḥ ca praṇidhāya pāpakam  asatam hi vadanti pāpa cittā narakam vardhayate vadhāya nityam
translated: Six hundred and thirty-five times ten million, and one hundred thousand times ten million,🔽Those who, through body, speech, and mind, have committed evil deeds, go to those hells.🔽For those of evil mind speak untruth, always increasing hell for the sake of killing.

original: anavadya balas titīkṣate tām manaso hy āvilatām vivarjayitvā // titikṣate
analyzed: anavadya balaḥ titīkṣate tām manasaḥ hi āvila tām vivarjayitvā titikṣate
translated: But one who is powerful and faultless endures that, avoiding mental agitation.

original: yaḥ śāsanam hy arhatām āryāṇām dharma jīvinām /
analyzed: yaḥ śāsanam hi arhatām āryāṇām dharma jīvinām
translated: He who opposes the teaching of the noble and worthy ones who live by the Dharma,

original: pratikrośati durmedhā dṛṣṭim nihśritya pāpikām /
analyzed: pratikrośati durmedhā dṛṣṭim nihśritya pāpikām
translated: the evil-minded one, relying on a pernicious view,

original: kalyāṇikām vimuñceta na eva muñceta pāpikām /
analyzed: kalyāṇikām vimuñceta na eva muñceta pāpikām
