original: ākāśaiva śakuntānām padam teṣām duranvayam //
analyzed: ākāśā eva śakuntānām padam teṣām duranvayam
translated: The sky is the birds' path, difficult to follow.

original: yeṣām bhavaḥ parikṣīṇo hy aparāntam ca na āśritāḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām bhavaḥ parikṣīṇaḥ hi aparāntam ca naḥ āśritāḥ
translated: Those whose existence is exhausted, who do not rely on the end,

original: śunyatā ca animittam ca vivekaś caiva gocaraḥ / śūnyatā
analyzed: śunyatā ca animittam ca vivekaḥ ca eva gocaraḥ śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness, the signless, and the detached are the domain.

original: ākāśaiva śakuntānām gatis teṣām duranvayā //
analyzed: ākāśā eva śakuntānām gatiḥ teṣām duranvayā
translated: The sky is the path of birds, but it is difficult for them to follow.

original: yeṣām bhavaḥ parikṣīṇo hy aparāntam ca na āśritāḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām bhavaḥ parikṣīṇaḥ hi aparāntam ca naḥ āśritāḥ
translated: For those whose existence is exhausted, and who do not rely on the end,

original: śunyatā ca animittam ca samādhiś caiva gocaraḥ / śūnyatā
analyzed: śunyatā ca animittam ca samādhiḥ ca eva gocaraḥ śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness, the signless, and concentration are the domain.

original: ākāśaiva śakuntānām padam teṣām duranvayam //
analyzed: ākāśā eva śakuntānām padam teṣām duranvayam
translated: The sky is the abode of birds, but it is difficult for them to follow.

original: yeṣām bhavaḥ parikṣīṇo hy aparāntam ca na āśritāḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām bhavaḥ parikṣīṇaḥ hi aparāntam ca naḥ āśritāḥ
translated: For those whose existence is exhausted, and who do not rely on the end,

original: śunyatā ca animittam ca samādhiś caiva gocaraḥ / śūnyatā
analyzed: śunyatā ca animittam ca samādhiḥ ca eva gocaraḥ śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness, the signless, and concentration are the domain.

original: ākāśaiva śakuntānām gatis teṣām duranvayā //
analyzed: ākāśā eva śakuntānām gatiḥ teṣām duranvayā
translated: The sky is the path of birds, but it is difficult for them to follow.

original: alpakās te mauṣyeṣu ye janāḥ pāragāminaḥ /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te mauṣyeṣu ye janāḥ pāra gāminaḥ
translated: Few are the people among mortals who reach the other shore.

original: atha iyam itarāḥ prajās tīram eva anudhāvati //
analyzed: atha iyam itarāḥ prajāḥ tīram eva anudhāvati
translated: But the rest of humanity runs only to the bank.

original: ye tarhi samyag ākhyāte dharme dharma anudarśinaḥ /
analyzed: ye tarhi samyak ākhyāte dharme dharma anudarśinaḥ
translated: But those who see the Dharma in the well-proclaimed Dharma,

original: te janāḥ pāram eṣyanti mṛtyu dheyasya sarvaśaḥ //
analyzed: te janāḥ pāram eṣyanti mṛtyu dheyasya sarvaśas
translated: they will all reach the other side of the realm of death.

original: gata adhvāno viśokasya vipramuktasya tāyinaḥ /
analyzed: gata adhvānaḥ viśokasya vipramuktasya tāyinaḥ
translated: For the one who has gone beyond, who is sorrowless, who is liberated, who is the protector,

original: sarva grantha prahīṇasya paridāgho na vidyate //
analyzed: sarva grantha prahīṇasya paridāghaḥ na vidyate
translated: for the one who has abandoned all bonds, there is no burning.

original: uttīrṇaḥ sabhayo mārgaḥ pātālaḥ parivarjitaḥ /
analyzed: uttīrṇaḥ sa bhayaḥ mārgaḥ pātālaḥ parivarjitaḥ
translated: The fearful path has been crossed, the nether world has been avoided,

original: mukto yogais tathā granthaiḥ sarvam rāga viṣam hatam //🔽na asti kāma samo hy ogho na asti doṣa samo grahaḥ /
analyzed: muktaḥ yogaiḥ tathā granthaiḥ sarvam rāga viṣam hatam  na asti kāma samaḥ hi oghaḥ na asti doṣa samaḥ grahaḥ
translated: freed from bonds and knots, all passion-poison has been destroyed.🔽There is no flood equal to desire, no grasping equal to hatred,

original: na asti moha samam jālam na asti tṛṣṭā samā nadī //
analyzed: na asti moha samam jālam na asti tṛṣṭā samā nadī
translated: no net equal to delusion, no river equal to craving.

original: ākāśe tu padam na asti śramaṇo na asti bāhyakaḥ /🔽prapañca abhiratā bālā niṣprapañcās tathāgatāḥ //
analyzed: ākāśe tu padam na asti śramaṇaḥ na asti bāhyakaḥ  prapañca abhiratāḥ bālāḥ niṣprapañcāḥ tathāgatāḥ
translated: There is no foothold in the sky, no outsider is a renunciant,🔽the foolish delight in conceptual elaboration, the Tathāgatas are free from conceptual elaboration.

original: yogaiḥ samuhyate bālo yogān nudati paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: yogaiḥ samuhyate bālaḥ yogān nudati paṇḍitaḥ
translated: The fool is bound by bonds, the wise one removes bonds,

original: yogān praṇudya medhāvī ye divyā ye ca mānuṣāḥ //
analyzed: yogān praṇudya medhāvī ye divyāḥ ye ca mānuṣāḥ
translated: having removed the bonds, both divine and human, the wise one

original: yogād bhavaḥ prabhavati viyogād bhava saṃkṣayaḥ /
analyzed: yogāt bhavaḥ prabhavati viyogāt bhava saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: Existence arises from bonds, the destruction of existence is from the removal of bonds.

original: etad dvaidhā patham jñātvā bhavāya vibhavāya ca /
analyzed: etad dvaidhā patham jñātvā bhavāya vibhavāya ca
translated: Having known this twofold path, for existence and non-existence,

original: tatra śikṣeta medhāvī yatra yogān atikramet //
analyzed: tatra śikṣeta medhāvī yatra yogān atikramet
translated: there the wise one should train, where one goes beyond bonds.

original: akṛtam kukṛtāt śreyaḥ paścāt tapati duṣkṛtam /
analyzed: akṛtam kukṛtāt śreyaḥ paścāt tapati duṣkṛtam
translated: The unmade is better than the ill-made, the ill-made burns afterwards,

original: śocate duṣkṛtam kṛtvā śocate durgatim gataḥ //
analyzed: śocate duṣkṛtam kṛtvā śocate durgatim gataḥ
translated: having done the ill-made one burns, one burns having gone to a bad destination.

original: kṛtam tu sukṛtam śreyo yat kṛtvā na anutapyate /
analyzed: kṛtam tu sukṛtam śreyaḥ yat kṛtvā na anutapyate
translated: But the well-made is better, having done what one does not burn,

original: nandate sukṛtam kṛtvā nandate sugatim gataḥ //
analyzed: nandate sukṛtam kṛtvā nandate sugatim gataḥ
translated: Rejoices when he has done good, rejoices when he has gone to a good bourn.

original: na abhāṣamānā jñāyante miśrā bālair hi paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: na abhāṣamānāḥ jñāyante miśrāḥ bālaiḥ hi paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise are not known when they are silent, for they are confused with fools.

original: jñāyante bhāṣamānās tu deṣayanto arajaḥ padam //
analyzed: jñāyante bhāṣamānāḥ tu deṣayantaḥ arajaḥ padam
translated: But when they speak they are known, for they proclaim the dustless state.

original: bhāṣayed dyotayed dharmam ucchrayed ṛṣiṇām dhvajam /
analyzed: bhāṣayet dyotayet dharmam ucchrayet ṛṣiṇām dhvajam
translated: He should speak and illuminate the Dhamma, he should raise the banner of the seers.

original: subhāṣita dhvajā nityam ṛṣayor dharma gauravāḥ //
analyzed: dhvajāḥ nityam ṛṣayoḥ dharma gauravāḥ
translated: The seers, who always have the banner of good speech, are honoured for their respect for Dhamma.

original: nindanti tuṣṇim āsīnam nindanti bahu bhāṣiṇam / tūṣṇīm āsīnam
analyzed: nindanti tuṣṇim āsīnam nindanti bahu bhāṣiṇam tūṣṇīm āsīnam
translated: They blame one who sits silently, they blame one who speaks much, they blame one who sits silently

original: alpa bhāṇim ca nindanti na asti lokeṣv aninditaḥ //
analyzed: alpa bhāṇim ca nindanti na asti lokeṣu aninditaḥ
translated: and speaks little. There is no one in the world who is not blamed.

original: ekānta ninditaḥ puruṣaḥ ekāntam vā praśaṃsitaḥ /
analyzed: ekānta ninditaḥ puruṣaḥ ekāntam vā praśaṃsitaḥ
translated: A man who is completely blamed or completely praised,

original: na abhūd bhaviṣyati ca no na ca apy etarhi vidyate //
analyzed: na abhūt bhaviṣyati ca no na ca api etarhi vidyate
translated: has not existed, will not exist, and does not exist now.

original: yam tu vijñāḥ praśaṃsanti hy anuyujya śubha aśubham /
analyzed: yam tu vijñāḥ praśaṃsanti hi anuyujya śubha aśubham
translated: But one whom the wise praise after examining what is good and bad,

original: praśaṃsā sā samākhyātā na tv ajñair yaḥ praśaṃsitaḥ //
analyzed: praśaṃsā sā samākhyātā na tu ajñaiḥ yaḥ praśaṃsitaḥ
translated: that praise is called true, not one praised by the ignorant.

original: medhāvinam vṛtta yuktam prājñam śīleṣu saṃvṛtam /
analyzed: medhāvinam vṛtta yuktam prājñam śīleṣu saṃvṛtam
translated: The wise, who are endowed with good conduct, are restrained in their actions,

original: niṣkam jāmbunadasya eva kas tam ninditum arhati //
analyzed: niṣkam jāmbunadasya eva kaḥ tam ninditum arhati
translated: who is like pure gold from the Jambu River, who is worthy of blame?

original: śailo yathā apy eka ghano vāyunā na prakampyate /
analyzed: śailaḥ yathā api ghanaḥ vāyunā na prakampyate
translated: Just as a mountain, even if it is a single massive rock, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam nindā praśaṃsābhir na kampyante hi paṇḍitāḥ //
analyzed: evam nindā praśaṃsābhiḥ na kampyante hi paṇḍitāḥ
translated: so the wise are not shaken by blame or praise.

original: yasya mūle tvacā na asti parṇā na asti tathā latāḥ /
analyzed: yasya mūle tvacā na asti parṇā na asti tathā latāḥ
translated: He who has no bark, no leaves, no vines at the root,

original: tam dhīram bandhanān muktam kas tam ninditum arhati //
analyzed: tam dhīram bandhanāt muktam kaḥ tam ninditum arhati
translated: who is firm, released from bondage, who is he that should blame him?

original: yasya ha prapañcitam hi no sat saṃtānam parikham ca yo nivṛttaḥ /
analyzed: yasya ha prapañcitam hi no sat saṃtānam parikham ca yaḥ nivṛttaḥ
translated: He whose continuity of existence has been analyzed, who has turned away from the moat,

original: tṛṣṇā vigatam munim carantam na vijānāti sadevako api lokaḥ //
analyzed: tṛṣṇā vigatam munim carantam na vijānāti sadevakaḥ api lokaḥ
translated: the sage who wanders free from craving, is not known even by the world with its gods.

original: yasya jitam na upajīyate jitam anveti na kaṃcid eva loke /
analyzed: yasya jitam na upajīyate jitam anveti na kaṃcid eva loke
translated: He whose victory is not regained, whose victory no one in the world follows,

original: tam buddham ananta gocaram hy apadam kena padena neṣyasi //
analyzed: tam buddham ananta gocaram hi apadam kena padena neṣyasi
translated: that Buddha, whose range is infinite, who is without feet, by what foot will you lead him?

original: yasya jālinī viṣaktikā tṛṣṇā na asti hi loka nāyinī /
analyzed: yasya jālinī viṣaktikā tṛṣṇā na asti hi loka nāyinī
translated: He who has no craving, which is a net, a snare, which leads the world,

original: tam buddham ananta gocaram hy apadam kena padena neṣyasi //
analyzed: tam buddham ananta gocaram hi apadam kena padena neṣyasi
translated: that Buddha, whose range is infinite, who is without feet, by what foot will you lead him?

original: yasya mūlam kṣitau na asti parṇā na asti tathā latāḥ /
analyzed: yasya mūlam kṣitau na asti parṇā na asti tathā latāḥ
translated: He who has no root in the earth, no leaves, no vines,

original: tam dhīram bandhanān muktam ko nu ninditum arhati //
analyzed: tam dhīram bandhanāt muktam kaḥ nu ninditum arhati
translated: who is firm, released from bondage, who is he that should blame him?

original: yasya jālinī viṣaktikā tṛṣṇā na asti hi loka nāyinī /
analyzed: yasya jālinī viṣaktikā tṛṣṇā na asti hi loka nāyinī
translated: He who has no craving, that net and snare which leads the world astray,

original: tam buddham ananta vikramam hy apadam kena padena neṣyasi //
analyzed: tam buddham ananta vikramam hi apadam kena padena neṣyasi
translated: How will you lead with your foot that Buddha of infinite valor, who is without a foot?

original: yasya vitarkā vidhūpitās tv ādhyātmam vinivartitā hy aśeṣam /
analyzed: yasya vitarkāḥ vidhūpitāḥ tu ādhyātmam vinivartitāḥ hi aśeṣam
translated: He who has completely eliminated and turned away from all discursive thoughts within,

original: sa hi saṅgam atītya sarva saṃjñām yoga apetam atīrṇa saṅgam eti //
analyzed: sa hi saṅgam atītya sarva saṃjñām yoga apetam atīrṇa saṅgam eti
translated: He, having gone beyond all attachments and conceptions, reaches the state free from yoga and beyond attachment.

original: muñca purato muñca paścato madhye muñca bhavasya pāragaḥ / paścāto
analyzed: muñca puratas muñca paścatas madhye muñca bhavasya pāragaḥ
translated: Let go in front, let go behind, let go in the middle, and cross to the other shore of existence.

original: sarvatra viṃkuta mānaso na punar jāti jarām upeṣyasi //
analyzed: sarvatra mānasaḥ na punar jāti jarām upeṣyasi
translated: With a mind free from attachment everywhere, you will not return to birth and old age again.

original: sukhavarga
analyzed: sukha varga
translated: The Chapter on Happiness

original: jayād vairam prasavate duhkham śete parājitaḥ /
analyzed: jayāt vairam prasavate duhkham śete parājitaḥ
translated: From victory arises enmity, and the defeated one sleeps in sorrow.

original: upaśāntaḥ sukham śete hitvā jaya parājayau //
analyzed: upaśāntaḥ sukham śete hitvā jaya parājayau
translated: The one who is peaceful sleeps happily, having abandoned victory and defeat.

original: para duhkha upadhānena ya /icchet sukham ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: para duhkha upadhānena yā ecchet sukham ātmanaḥ
translated: One who desires happiness for oneself through inflicting suffering on others,

original: vaira saṃsarga saṃsakto duhkhān na parimucyate //
analyzed: vaira saṃsarga saṃsaktaḥ duhkhāt na parimucyate
translated: Entangled in the bonds of enmity, is not liberated from suffering.

original: sukha kāmāni bhūtāni yo daṇḍena vihiṃṣati /
analyzed: sukha kāmāni bhūtāni yaḥ daṇḍena vihiṃṣati
translated: One who harms beings seeking happiness through punishment,

original: ātmanaḥ sukham eṣāṇaḥ sa vai na labhate sukham //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ sukham eṣāṇaḥ sa vai na labhate sukham
translated: Seeking happiness for oneself, does not attain happiness.

original: sukha kāmāni bhūtāni yo daṇḍena na hiṃsati /
analyzed: sukha kāmāni bhūtāni yaḥ daṇḍena na hiṃsati
translated: One who does not harm beings seeking happiness through punishment,

original: ātmanaḥ sukham eṣāṇaḥ sa pretya labhate sukham //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ sukham eṣāṇaḥ sa pretya labhate sukham
translated: Seeking his own happiness, he obtains happiness after death.

original: dharmam caret sucaritam na enam duścaritam caret /
analyzed: dharmam caret sucaritam na enam duścaritam caret
translated: One should practice Dharma and good conduct, not bad conduct.

original: dharma cārī sukham śete hy asmin loke paratra ca //
analyzed: dharma cārī sukham śete hi asmin loke paratra ca
translated: One who practices Dharma sleeps happily in this world and the next.

original: dharmaḥ sadā rakṣati dharma cāriṇam chatram mahad varṣa kāle yathaiva /
analyzed: dharmaḥ sadā rakṣati dharma cāriṇam chatram mahat varṣa kāle yathā eva
translated: Dharma always protects the one who practices Dharma, just like a large umbrella during the rainy season.

original: eṣa anuśaṃso dharme sucīrṇe na durgatim gacchati dharma cārī //
analyzed: eṣa anuśaṃsaḥ dharme su cīrṇe na durgatim gacchati dharma cārī
translated: This is the benefit of well-practiced Dharma - one who practices Dharma does not go to a bad rebirth.

original: dharmaḥ sadā rakṣati dharma cāriṇam dharmaḥ sucīrṇaḥ sukham ādadhāti /
analyzed: dharmaḥ sadā rakṣati dharma cāriṇam dharmaḥ sucīrṇaḥ sukham ādadhāti
translated: Dharma always protects the one who practices Dharma, well-practiced Dharma brings happiness.

original: eṣa anuśaṃso dharme sucīrṇe na durgatim gacchati dharma cārī //
analyzed: eṣa anuśaṃsaḥ dharme su cīrṇe na durgatim gacchati dharma cārī
translated: This is the benefit of well-practiced Dharma - one who practices Dharma does not go to a bad rebirth.

original: alpā api santo bahavo jayanti susaṃvidhāne na saṃvidhānam /
analyzed: alpāḥ api santaḥ bahavaḥ jayanti su saṃvidhāne na saṃvidhānam
translated: Even many small ones can win if well-organized, not if unorganized.

original: alpam api cet śraddadhāno dadāti tena eva asau bhavati sukhī paratra //
analyzed: alpam api ced śraddadhānaḥ dadāti tena eva asau bhavati sukhī paratra
translated: Even if one gives a little with faith, by that alone one becomes happy in the next world.

original: dānam ca yuddham ca samānam āhur na ete guṇāḥ kāpuruṣā iva santi /
analyzed: dānam ca yuddham ca samānam āhuḥ na ete guṇāḥ kāpuruṣāḥ iva santi
translated: They say giving and fighting are the same - these qualities are not like those of cowards.

original: saṃgrāma velā iva hi dāna velā tulyam bhavet kāraṇa saṃgraheṇa //
analyzed: saṃgrāma velā iva hi dāna velā tulyam bhavet kāraṇa saṃgraheṇa
translated: For in the time of battle, as in the time of giving, the gathering of causes would be the same.

original: ayam hi pratyūha śatāni jitvā mātsaryam ākramya ca śatru bhūtam /
analyzed: ayam hi pratyūha śatāni jitvā mātsaryam ākramya ca śatru bhūtam
translated: For he has conquered hundreds of obstacles and overcome stinginess, which is an enemy.🔽I say that he is braver than a brave man,

original: śurādd hi tam śūrataram vadāmi dadāti yo dānam asakta cittaḥ / śūrād
analyzed: śurāt hi tam śūrataram vadāmi dadāti yaḥ dānam asakta cittaḥ śūrāt
translated: who gives gifts with an unattached mind.

original: sukho vipākaḥ puṇyānām abhiprāyaḥ samṛdhyate /
analyzed: sukhaḥ vipākaḥ puṇyānām abhiprāyaḥ samṛdhyate
translated: The result of merit is happiness, one's intentions are fulfilled,

original: kṣipram ca paramām śāntim nirvṛtim so adhigacchati //🔽parato hy upasargāṃś ca devatā māra kāyikāḥ /
analyzed: kṣipram ca paramām śāntim nirvṛtim soḥ adhigacchati  paratas hi upasargān ca devatāḥ māra kāyikāḥ
translated: and one quickly attains the highest peace, nirvana.🔽For one who has made merit, the gods and Mara's hosts,

original: antarāyam na śaktiṣṭhāḥ kṛta puṇyasya kartu vai //🔽dharma prītiḥ sukham śete viprasannena cetasā /
analyzed: antarāyam na śaktiṣṭhāḥ kṛta puṇyasya kartu vai  dharma prītiḥ sukham śete viprasannena cetasā
translated: which are obstacles from others, are unable to create an obstacle.🔽One who delights in the Dharma sleeps happily with a serene mind.

original: ārya pravedite dharme ramate paṇḍitaḥ smṛtaḥ //
analyzed: ārya pravedite dharme ramate paṇḍitaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The wise one delights in the Dharma taught by the noble ones and is mindful.

original: yeṣām dharma ratam cittam anupādāya nirvṛtim /
analyzed: yeṣām dharma ratam cittam an upādāya nirvṛtim
translated: Those whose mind delights in the Dharma, without attachment, attain nirvana,

original: smṛty upasthāna niratam bodhy aṅgeṣu ca saptasu //
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna niratam bodhi aṅgeṣu ca saptasu
translated: and are devoted to the establishments of mindfulness and the seven factors of awakening.

original: yeṣām dharma ratm cittam anupādāya nirvṛtim /
analyzed: yeṣām dharma ratm cittam an upādāya nirvṛtim
translated: Those whose mind delights in the Dharma, without attachment, attain nirvana,

original: ṛddhi pāda ratam caiva mārge ca aṣṭa aṅgike ratam //
analyzed: ṛddhi pāda ratam ca eva mārge ca aṣṭa aṅgike ratam
translated: and are devoted to the bases of spiritual power and the eightfold path.

original: sukham te bhuñjate piṇḍam dhārayanti ca cīvaram /
analyzed: sukham te bhuñjate piṇḍam dhārayanti ca cīvaram
translated: They enjoy the almsfood happily and maintain their robes.

original: sukham caṅkramaṇam teṣām parvateṣu guhāsu ca //
analyzed: sukham caṅkramaṇam teṣām parvateṣu guhāsu ca
translated: They will find happiness in walking on mountains and in caves.

original: kṣema prāptā hi sukhitā dṛṣṭa dharma abhinirvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: kṣema prāptāḥ hi sukhitāḥ dṛṣṭa dharma abhinirvṛtāḥ
translated: They have attained security and are happy, having realized the Dharma in this very life.

original: sarva vaira bhaya atītās tīrṇā loke viṣaktikām //
analyzed: sarva vaira bhaya atītāḥ tīrṇā loke viṣaktikām
translated: They have gone beyond all enmity and fear, and have crossed over the world's entanglements.

original: sukho vivekas tuṣṭasya śruta dharmasya paśyataḥ /🔽avyāvadhyaḥ sukham loke prāṇa bhūteṣu samyamaḥ //
analyzed: sukhaḥ vivekaḥ tuṣṭasya śruta dharmasya paśyataḥ  avyāvadhyaḥ sukham loke prāṇa bhūteṣu samyamaḥ
translated: Seclusion is happiness for one who is content, who sees having heard the Dharma.🔽Not harming is happiness in the world, restraint towards living beings.

original: sukham virāgatā loke kāmānām samatikramaḥ /
analyzed: sukham virāgatā loke kāmānām samatikramaḥ
translated: Dispassion towards the world is happiness, transcending sensual pleasures.

original: asmi mānasya vinaya /etad vai paramam sukham //
analyzed: asmi mānasya vinaya etat vai paramam sukham
translated: Subduing conceit - that is indeed the highest happiness.

original: sukham yāvaj jarā śīlam sukham śraddhā pratiṣṭhitā /
analyzed: sukham yāvaj jarā śīlam sukham śraddhā pratiṣṭhitā
translated: Morality is happiness as long as old age, happiness is faith well established.

original: sukham ca artha ratā vācā pāpasya akaraṇam sukham //
analyzed: sukham ca artha ratā vācā pāpasya akaraṇam sukham
translated: Happiness is delight in meaning, happiness is the non-doing of evil.

original: sukham mātṛvyatā loke sukham caiva pitṛvyatā /
analyzed: sukham mātṛvya tā loke sukham ca eva pitṛvya tā
translated: Kindness to one's mother in the world is happiness, and likewise kindness to one's father.

original: sukham śrāmaṇyatā loke tathā brāhmaṇyatā sukham //
analyzed: sukham śrāmaṇyatā loke tathā brāhmaṇyatā sukham
translated: Kindness to ascetics in the world is happiness, and likewise kindness to brahmins.

original: sukham buddhasya ca utpādaḥ sukham dharmasya deśanā /
analyzed: sukham buddhasya ca utpādaḥ sukham dharmasya deśanā
translated: The arising of a Buddha is happiness, the teaching of the Dharma is happiness.

original: sukham saṃghasya sāmagrī samagrāṇām tapaḥ sukham //
analyzed: sukham saṃghasya sāmagrī samagrāṇām tapaḥ sukham
translated: The harmony of the Sangha is happiness, the austerity of those in harmony is happiness.

original: śīlavantaḥ sukham dṛṣṭum sukham dṛṣṭum bahu śrutāḥ / draṣṭum
analyzed: śīlavantaḥ sukham dṛṣṭum sukham dṛṣṭum bahu śrutāḥ draṣṭum
translated: The virtuous are happy to see, the learned are happy to see, the contented are happy to see, the generous are happy to see.

original: arhantaś ca sukham dṛṣṭum vipramukta punar bhavāḥ //
analyzed: arhantaḥ ca sukham dṛṣṭum vipramukta punar bhavāḥ
translated: And the Arhats, who are happy to see the end of rebirth.

original: sukhā nadī sūpatīrthā sukham dharmajino jinaḥ /
analyzed: sukhā nadī su upatīrthā sukham dharma jinaḥ jinaḥ
translated: The river of happiness has good fords; happiness is the Jina who is Dharma;

original: prajñā lābhaḥ sukho nityam asmi māna kṣayaḥ sukham //🔽sukham darśanam āryāṇām saṃvāso api sadā sukham /
analyzed: prajñā lābhaḥ sukhaḥ nityam asmi māna kṣayaḥ sukham  sukham darśanam āryāṇām saṃvāsaḥ api sadā sukham
translated: The attainment of wisdom is always happiness; the destruction of the conceit of I is happiness.🔽The sight of the noble ones is happiness; living with them is always happiness.

original: adarśanena bālānām nityam eva sukhī bhavet //
analyzed: adarśanena bālānām nityam eva sukhī bhavet
translated: By not seeing the foolish, one will always be happy.

original: bāla saṃsarga cārī hi dīrgha adhvānam praśocati /
analyzed: bāla saṃsarga cārī hi dīrgha adhvānam praśocati
translated: For one who associates with the foolish grieves for a long time.

original: duhkho bālair hi saṃvāso hy amitrair iva sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: duhkhaḥ bālaiḥ hi saṃvāsaḥ hi amitraiḥ iva sarvaśas
translated: Association with the foolish is painful, like with enemies in every way.

original: dhīrais tu sukha saṃvāso jñātīnām iva saṃgamaḥ //
analyzed: dhīraiḥ tu sukha saṃvāsaḥ jñātīnām iva saṃgamaḥ
translated: But association with the wise is pleasant, like the gathering of kinsmen.

original: durlabhaḥ puruṣo jātyo na asau sarvatra jāyate /
analyzed: durlabhaḥ puruṣaḥ jātyaḥ na asau sarvatra jāyate
translated: A man of noble birth is difficult to find; he is not born everywhere.

original: yatra asau jāyate vīras tu kulam sukham edhate //
analyzed: yatra asau jāyate vīraḥ tu kulam sukham edhate
translated: Where that hero is born, the family prospers with happiness.

original: sarvathā vai sukham śete brāhmaṇaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sarvathā vai sukham śete brāhmaṇaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: In every way, the Brahmin who has attained final Nirvana sleeps happily,

original: yo na lipyate kāmebhir vipramukto nirāsravaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ na lipyate kāmebhiḥ vipramuktaḥ nirāsravaḥ
translated: He who is not smeared by sensual pleasures, liberated, free from defilements.

original: sarvā hy āśāstayaś chittvā vinīya hṛdaya jvaram /
analyzed: sarvāḥ hi āśā āstayaḥ chittvā vinīya jvaram
translated: Having cut off all hopes and desires, having removed the fever of the heart,

original: upaśāntaḥ sukham śete śāntim prāpya iha cetasaḥ //
analyzed: upaśāntaḥ sukham śete śāntim prāpya iha cetasaḥ
translated: The peaceful one sleeps happily, having attained peace of mind in this world.

original: mātrā sukha parityāgād yaḥ paśyed vipulam sukham /
analyzed: mātrā sukha parityāgāt yaḥ paśyet vipulam sukham
translated: He who sees great happiness in giving up the happiness of the senses,

original: tyajen mātrā sukham dhīraḥ sampaśyan vipulam sukham //
analyzed: tyajet mātrā sukham dhīraḥ sampaśyan vipulam sukham
translated: The wise one should give up the happiness of the senses, seeing great happiness.

original: yac ca kāma sukham loke yac ca api divijam sukham /
analyzed: yat ca kāma sukham loke yat ca api divijam sukham
translated: The happiness of the senses in the world and the happiness of the gods,

original: tṛṣṇā kṣaya sukhasya etat kalām na arghati ṣoḍaśīm //
analyzed: tṛṣṇā kṣaya sukhasya etat kalām na arghati ṣoḍaśīm
translated: Do not equal a sixteenth part of the happiness of the destruction of craving.

original: nikṣipya hi gurum bhāram na ādadyād bhāram eva tu /
analyzed: nikṣipya hi gurum bhāram na ādadyāt bhāram eva tu
translated: Having put down a heavy burden, one should not take up another burden.

original: bhāra ādānam param duhkham bhāra nikṣepaṇam sukham //
analyzed: bhāra ādānam param duhkham bhāra nikṣepaṇam sukham
translated: Taking up a burden is great suffering, putting down a burden is happiness.

original: sarva tṛṣṇām viprahāya sarva samyojana kṣayāt /
analyzed: sarva tṛṣṇām viprahāya sarva samyojana kṣayāt
translated: Having abandoned all craving, through the destruction of all fetters,

original: sarva upadhim parijñāya na āgacchanti punar bhavam //
analyzed: sarva upadhim parijñāya na āgacchanti punar bhavam
translated: Having fully understood all attachments, they do not return to renewed existence.

original: artheṣu jāteṣu sukham sahāyāḥ puṇyam sukham jīvita saṃkṣayeṣu /
analyzed: artheṣu jāteṣu sukham sahāyāḥ puṇyam sukham jīvita saṃkṣayeṣu
translated: In matters of wealth, friends are happy; in the end of life, merit is happy.

original: tuṣṭiḥ sukhā yā tv itaretareṇa sarvasya duhkhasya sukho nirodhaḥ //
analyzed: tuṣṭiḥ sukhā yā tu itaretareṇa sarvasya duhkhasya sukhaḥ nirodhaḥ
translated: Contentment is happiness, and the cessation of all suffering is happiness.

original: ayoghana hatasya eva jvalato jāta vedasaḥ /
analyzed: ayoghana hatasya eva jvalataḥ jāta vedasaḥ
translated: Just as the course of a blazing fire struck by an iron hammer,

original: anupūrva upaśāntasya yathā na jñāyate gatiḥ //
analyzed: anupūrvaḥ upaśāntasya yathā na jñāyate gatiḥ
translated: Is not known as it gradually subsides,

original: evam samyag vimuktānām kāma paṅka ogha tāriṇām /
analyzed: evam samyak vimuktānām kāma paṅka ogha tāriṇām
translated: So also for those who are rightly liberated, who have crossed the mire and flood of desire,

original: prajñāpayitum gatir na asti prāptānām acalam sukham //
analyzed: prajñāpayitum gatiḥ na asti prāptānām acalam sukham
translated: There is no way to make them understand the unshakable happiness of those who have attained it.

original: yasya antarato na santi kopā /ittham bhāva gatam ca yo nivṛttaḥ /
analyzed: yasya antarataḥ na santi kopāittham bhāva gatam ca yaḥ nivṛttaḥ
translated: He who has no anger within, and who has turned away from such states,

original: akhilam tam sukhinam sadā viśokam devā na anubhavanti darśanena //
analyzed: akhilam tam sukhinam sadā viśokam devā na anubhavanti darśanena
translated: The gods do not experience the sight of him, who is completely happy and always griefless.

original: sukham hi yasya iha na kiṃcanam syāt svākhyāta dharmasya bahu śrutasya / kiṃcana
analyzed: sukham hi yasya iha na kiṃcanam syāt svākhyāta dharmasya bahu śrutasya kiṃcana
translated: For he who has nothing here, who has heard much of the well-proclaimed Dharma,

original: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu pratibaddha cittam //
analyzed: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu pratibaddha cittam
translated: See the one who has something, who is afflicted, the person whose mind is attached to people.

original: sukham hi yasya iha na kiṃcanam syāt svākhyāta dharmasya bahu śrutasya / kiṃcana
analyzed: sukham hi yasya iha na kiṃcanam syāt svākhyāta dharmasya bahu śrutasya kiṃcana
translated: For he who has nothing here, who has heard much of the well-proclaimed Dharma,

original: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu pratibaddha rūpam //identical ṛih
analyzed: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu pratibaddha rūpam identical ṛih
translated: See the one who has something, who is afflicted, the person whose form is bound to people.

original: sukhino hi janā hy akiṃcanā veda guṇā hi janā hy akiṃcanāḥ /
analyzed: sukhinaḥ hi janāḥ hi akiṃcanāḥ veda guṇāḥ hi janāḥ hi akiṃcanāḥ
translated: For people who have nothing are happy, people who have nothing have the qualities of knowledge.

original: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu baddha cittam //
analyzed: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu baddha cittam
translated: See the one who has something, who is afflicted, the person whose mind is attached to people.

original: sukhino hi janā /akiṃcanā veda guṇā hi janā hy akiṃcanāḥ /
analyzed: sukhinaḥ hi janāḥ akiṃcanāḥ veda guṇāḥ hi janāḥ hi akiṃcanāḥ
translated: For people who have nothing are happy, people who have nothing have the qualities of knowledge.

original: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu pratibaddha rūpam //
analyzed: sakiṃcanam paśya vihanyamānam janam janeṣu pratibaddha rūpam
translated: Look at the man who has something, who is being destroyed, who is attached to people.

original: sarvam para vaśam duhkham sarvam ātma vaśam sukham /
analyzed: sarvam para vaśam duhkham sarvam ātma vaśam sukham
translated: All suffering is under the control of others, all happiness is under one's own control.

original: sādhāraṇe vihanyante yogā hi duratikramāḥ //
analyzed: sādhāraṇe vihanyante yogāḥ hi duratikramāḥ
translated: In what is shared, attachments are destroyed, for attachments are difficult to overcome.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo hy utsukeṣu tv anutsukāḥ /
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ hi utsukeṣu tu an utsukāḥ
translated: Oh, how happily we live, unconcerned among the concerned!

original: utsukeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmo hy anutsukāḥ //
analyzed: utsukeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmaḥ hi an utsukāḥ
translated: Among the concerned people, we live unconcerned.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo yeṣām no na asti kiṃcanam / kiṃcana
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ yeṣām no na asti kiṃcanam kiṃcana
translated: Oh, how happily we live, for whom nothing exists!

original: mithilāyām dahyamānāyām na no dahyati kiṃcanam //
analyzed: mithilāyām dahyamānāyām na naḥ dahyati kiṃcanam
translated: When Mithila is burning, nothing of ours is burning.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo hy ātureṣu tv anāturāḥ /
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ hi ātureṣu tu anāturāḥ
translated: Oh, how happily we live, healthy among the sick!

original: ātureṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmo hy anāturāḥ //
analyzed: ātureṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmaḥ hi anāturāḥ
translated: Among the sick people, we live healthy.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo hiṃsakeṣu tv ahiṃsakāḥ /
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ hiṃsakeṣu tu ahiṃsakāḥ
translated: Oh, how happily we live, non-violent among the violent!

original: hiṃsakeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmo hy ahiṃsakāḥ //
analyzed: hiṃsakeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmaḥ hi ahiṃsakāḥ
translated: Among the violent people, we live non-violent.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo vairikeṣu tv avairikāḥ /
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ vairikeṣu tu a vairikāḥ
translated: Oh, how happily we live, without enmity among the hostile!

original: vairikeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmo hy avairikāḥ //
analyzed: vairikeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmaḥ hi a vairikāḥ
translated: Among the hostile people, we live without enmity.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo heṭhakeṣu tv aheṭhakāḥ /
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ heṭhakeṣu tu a heṭhakāḥ
translated: Oh, how happily we live, without malice among the malicious!

original: heṭhakeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmo hy aheṭhakaḥ //
analyzed: heṭhakeṣu manuṣyeṣu viharāmaḥ hi a heṭhakaḥ
translated: We live without harming, among humans who harm.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo yeṣām no na asti kiṃcanam / kiṃcana
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ yeṣām no na asti kiṃcanam kiṃcana
translated: Oh, how happily we live, for whom nothing exists!

original: prīti bhakṣā bhaviṣyāmo devā hy ābhasvarā yathā // ābhāsvarā
analyzed: prīti bhakṣāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ devāḥ hi ābhasvarāḥ yathā ābhāsvarā
translated: We will be nourished by joy, like the radiant gods.

original: susukham bata jīvāmo yeṣām no na asti kiṃcanam / kiṃcana
analyzed: su sukham bata jīvāmaḥ yeṣām no na asti kiṃcanam kiṃcana
translated: Oh, how happily we live, for whom nothing exists!

original: prīti bhakṣā bhaviṣyāmo satkāyena upanihśritāḥ //
analyzed: prīti bhakṣāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ satkāyena upanihśritāḥ
translated: We will be nourished by joy, supported by the true body.

original: grāme /araṇye sukha duhkha spṛṣṭo na eva ātmano na parato dadhāti /
analyzed: grāmearaṇye sukha duhkha spṛṣṭaḥ na eva ātmanaḥ na paratas dadhāti
translated: Whether touched by happiness or suffering in village or forest, one does not cling to self or others.

original: sparśāḥ spṛśanti hy upadhim pratītya niraupadhim kim sparśāḥ spṛśeyuḥ //
analyzed: sparśāḥ spṛśanti hi upadhim pratītya niraupadhim kim sparśāḥ spṛśeyuḥ
translated: Contacts touch only dependent on the aggregates. Without aggregates, what would contacts touch?

original: sāpatrapāḥ sat puruṣā bhavanti na kāma hetor lapayanti santaḥ /
analyzed: sa apatrapāḥ sat puruṣāḥ bhavanti na kāma hetoḥ lapayanti santaḥ
translated: Modest good people are not. The good do not lie for the sake of desire.

original: spṛṣṭā hi duhkhena tathā sukhena na ucca avacāḥ sat puruṣā bhavanti //
analyzed: spṛṣṭā hi duhkhena tathā sukhena na ucca avacāḥ sat puruṣāḥ bhavanti
translated: Being touched by suffering and likewise by happiness, good people do not become elated or depressed.

original: cittavarga
analyzed: citta varga
translated: The Chapter on the Mind

original: durnigrahasya laghuno yatra kāma nipātinaḥ /
analyzed: durnigrahasya laghunaḥ yatra kāma nipātinaḥ
translated: For the mind, which is difficult to control, fickle, and falls where it wants,

original: cittasya damanam sādhu cittam dāntam sukhāvaham //
analyzed: cittasya damanam sādhu cittam dāntam sukhāvaham
translated: Controlling the mind is good. A controlled mind brings happiness.

original: vārijo vā sthale kṣipta /okād oghāt samuddhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vāri jaḥ vā sthale kṣipta okāt oghāt samuddhṛtaḥ
translated: Like a lotus thrown on dry land, or pulled out of the water,

original: parispandati vai cittam māra dheyam prahātavai //
analyzed: parispandati vai cittam māra dheyam prahātavai
translated: The mind moves to and fro, and one should abandon the abode of Mara.

original: pṛthag vidhāvate cittam sūryasya iva hi raśmayaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthak vidhāvate cittam sūryasya iva hi raśmayaḥ
translated: The mind moves in different ways, like the rays of the sun.

original: tat paṇḍito vārayati hy aṅkuśena eva kuñjaram //
analyzed: tat paṇḍitaḥ vārayati hi aṅkuśena eva kuñjaram
translated: The wise one restrains it, like an elephant with a goad.

original: bhrūṇa dheyam idam cittam nihsāram anidarśanam /
analyzed: bhrūṇa dheyam idam cittam nihsāram anidarśanam
translated: This mind is like an embryo, without essence and invisible.

original: sadā enam anuśāsāmi mā me anarthāya niścaret //
analyzed: sadā enam anuśāsāmi mā me anarthāya niścaret
translated: I always instruct it, so that it may not go out for my harm.

original: idam purā cittam acāri cārikām yena icchakam yena kāmam yathā iṣṭam /
analyzed: idam purā cittam acāri cārikām yena icchakam yena kāmam yathā iṣṭam
translated: This mind has wandered in its wanderings before, as it wished, as it desired, as it liked.

original: tat samnigṛhṇāmi hi yoniśas tv idam nāgam prabhinnam hi yathā aṅkuśena //🔽anekam jāti saṃsāram saṃdhāvitvā punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: tat samnigṛhṇāmi hi yoniśas tu idam nāgam prabhinnam hi yathā aṅkuśena  anekam jāti saṃsāram saṃdhāvitvā punar punar
translated: I restrain it properly, like a broken-tusked elephant with a goad.🔽Having wandered through many births and deaths again and again,

original: gṛha kāraka eṣamāṇas tvam duhkhā jātiḥ punaḥ punaḥ //
analyzed: gṛha kāraka eṣamāṇaḥ tvam duhkhā jātiḥ punar punar
translated: seeking the maker of the house, you have been born into suffering again and again.

original: gṛha kāraka dṛṣṭo asi na punar geham kariṣyasi /
analyzed: gṛha kāraka dṛṣṭaḥ asi na punar geham kariṣyasi
translated: O house-builder, you are seen! You will not build the house again.

original: sarve te pārśukā bhagnā gṛha kūṭam visaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: sarve te pārśukā bhagnā gṛha kūṭam visaṃskṛtam
translated: All your rafters are broken, the ridgepole of the house is destroyed.

original: visaṃskāra gate citte /iha eva kṣayam adhyagāḥ //
analyzed: visaṃskāra gate citteihe eva kṣayam adhyagāḥ
translated: The mind, having gone to destruction, has attained cessation right here.

original: spandanam capalam cittam durakṣyam durnivāraṇam / dūrakṣyam
analyzed: spandanam capalam cittam durakṣyam durnivāraṇam dūrakṣyam
translated: The mind is restless, agitated, flighty, difficult to guard, difficult to restrain. It is far away, difficult to guard.

original: ṛjum karoti medhāvī /iṣu kāra /iva tejasā //
analyzed: ṛjum karoti medhāvīiṣu kārā eva tejasā
translated: The wise one makes it straight, like an arrow-maker with his arrow.

original: dūram gamam eka caram aśarīram guhāśayam /
analyzed: dūram gamam eka caram aśarīram guhāśayam
translated: Far-reaching, solitary, bodiless, dwelling in a cave,

original: ye cittam damayiṣyanti vimokṣyante mahā bhayāt /
analyzed: ye cittam damayiṣyanti vimokṣyante mahā bhayāt
translated: Those who will tame the mind will be liberated from great fear.

original: na dveṣī dveṣiṇaḥ kuryād vairī vā vairiṇo hitam /
analyzed: na dveṣī dveṣiṇaḥ kuryāt vairī vā vairiṇaḥ hitam
translated: An enemy does not do what is beneficial for an enemy, nor does a hater for a hater.

original: mithyā praṇihitam cittam yat kuryād ātmanā ātmanaḥ //
analyzed: mithyā praṇihitam cittam yat kuryāt ātmanā ātmanaḥ
translated: The mind wrongly directed, what it would do for oneself,

original: na tam mātā pitā vā api kuryāj jñātis tathā aparaḥ /
analyzed: na tam mātā pitā vā api kuryāt jñātiḥ tathā aparaḥ
translated: That neither a mother nor a father, nor a relative, nor anyone else would do.

original: samyak praṇihitam cittam yat kuryādd hitam ātmanaḥ //
analyzed: samyak praṇihitam cittam yat kuryāt hitam ātmanaḥ
translated: The mind rightly directed, what it would do for one's own benefit,

original: yathā hy agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā hi agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati
translated: Just as rain penetrates a poorly thatched house,

original: evam hy abhāvitam cittam rāgaḥ samatibhindati //
analyzed: evam hi a bhāvitam cittam rāgaḥ samatibhindati
translated: So does passion penetrate an undeveloped mind.

original: yathā hy agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā hi agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati
translated: Just as rain penetrates a poorly thatched house,

original: evam hy abhāvitam cittam dveṣaḥ samatibhindati //
analyzed: evam hi a bhāvitam cittam dveṣaḥ samatibhindati
translated: So does hatred penetrate an undeveloped mind.

original: yathā hy agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā hi agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati
translated: Just as rain penetrates a poorly thatched house,

original: evam hy abhāvitam cittam mohaḥ samatibhindati //
analyzed: evam hi a bhāvitam cittam mohaḥ samatibhindati
translated: So does delusion penetrate an undeveloped mind.

original: yathā hy agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā hi agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati
translated: Just as rain penetrates a poorly thatched house,

original: evam hy abhāvitam cittam mānaḥ samatibhindati //
analyzed: evam hi a bhāvitam cittam mānaḥ samatibhindati
translated: for thus, an undeveloped mind, conceit shatters.

original: yathā hy agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā hi agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati
translated: Just as rain shatters a badly thatched house,

original: evam hy abhāvitam cittam lobhaḥ samatibhindati //
analyzed: evam hi a bhāvitam cittam lobhaḥ samatibhindati
translated: so, an undeveloped mind, greed shatters.

original: yathā hy agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā hi agāram ducchannam vṛṣṭiḥ samatibhindati
translated: Just as rain shatters a badly thatched house,

original: evam hy abhāvitam cittam tṛṣṇā samatibhindati //
analyzed: evam hi a bhāvitam cittam tṛṣṇā samatibhindati
translated: so, an undeveloped mind, craving shatters.

original: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭir na vyatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭiḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: Just as rain does not shatter a well thatched house,

original: evam subhāvitam cittam rāgo na vyatibhindati //
analyzed: evam su bhāvitam cittam rāgaḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: so, a well developed mind, passion does not shatter.

original: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭir na vyatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭiḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: Just as rain does not shatter a well thatched house,

original: evam subhāvitam cittam dveṣo na vyatibhindati //
analyzed: evam su bhāvitam cittam dveṣaḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: so, a well developed mind, hatred does not shatter.

original: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭir na vyatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭiḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: Just as rain does not shatter a well thatched house,

original: evam subhāvitam cittam moho na vyatibhindati //
analyzed: evam su bhāvitam cittam mohaḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: so, a well developed mind, delusion does not shatter.

original: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭir na vyatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭiḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: Just as rain does not shatter a well thatched house,

original: evam subhāvitam cittam māno na vyatibhindati //
analyzed: evam su bhāvitam cittam mānaḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: so, a well developed mind, conceit does not shatter.

original: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭir na vyatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭiḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: Just as rain does not shatter a well thatched house,

original: evam subhāvitam cittam lobho na vyatibhindati //
analyzed: evam su bhāvitam cittam lobhaḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: In the same way, greed does not overcome a well-developed mind.

original: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭir na vyatibhindati /
analyzed: yathā agāram succhannam vṛṣṭiḥ na vyatibhindati
translated: Just as rain does not overcome a well-covered house,

original: evam subhāvitam cittam tṛṣṇā na vyatibhindati //
analyzed: evam subhāvitam cittam tṛṣṇā na vyatibhindati
translated: in the same way, craving does not overcome a well-developed mind.

original: manaḥ pūrvam gamā dharmā manaḥ śreṣṭhā mano javāḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ pūrvam gamā dharmā manaḥ śreṣṭhā manaḥ javāḥ
translated: The dharmas have mind as their forerunner, mind is their chief, and they are mind-made.

original: manasā hi praduṣṭena bhāṣate vā karoti vā /
analyzed: manasā hi praduṣṭena bhāṣate vā karoti vā
translated: If with a corrupted mind one speaks or acts,

original: manaḥ pūrvam gamā dharmā manaḥ śreṣṭhā mano javāḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ pūrvam gamā dharmā manaḥ śreṣṭhā manaḥ javāḥ
translated: The dharmas have mind as their forerunner, mind is their chief, and they are mind-made.

original: manasā hi prasannena bhāṣate vā karoti vā /
analyzed: manasā hi prasannena bhāṣate vā karoti vā
translated: If with a delighted mind one speaks or acts,

original: tatas tam sukham anveti chāyā vā hy anugāminī //
analyzed: tatas tam sukham anveti chāyā vā hi anugāminī
translated: then happiness follows like a shadow that never departs.

original: na aprasannena cittena duṣṭena kṣubhitena vā /
analyzed: na aprasannena cittena duṣṭena kṣubhitena vā
translated: Not with an unpleased, corrupted, or agitated mind,

original: dharmo hi śakyam ājñātum saṃrambha bahulena vā //
analyzed: dharmaḥ hi śakyam ājñātum saṃrambha bahulena vā
translated: nor with a mind full of resentment is the Dharma able to be known.

original: vinīya yas tu saṃrambham aprasādam ca cetasā /
analyzed: vinīya yaḥ tu saṃrambham aprasādam ca cetasā
translated: But one who has subdued resentment and displeasure in the mind,

original: āghātam caiva nihsṛjya prajānīyāt subhāṣitam //
analyzed: āghātam ca eva nihsṛjya prajānīyāt subhāṣitam
translated: and has also given up hostility, should recognize the well-spoken.

original: na pratyanīka sāreṇa suvijñeyam subhāṣitam /
analyzed: na pratyanīka sāreṇa suvijñeyam subhāṣitam
translated: The well-spoken is not easily discerned by one who is not patient,

original: upakliṣṭena cittena saṃrambha bahulena vā //
analyzed: upakliṣṭena cittena saṃrambha bahulena vā
translated: or by one whose mind is afflicted, or by one full of resentment.

original: anavasthita cittasya saddharmam avijānataḥ /
analyzed: anavasthita cittasya saddharmam avijānataḥ
translated: For one whose mind is unstable, who does not know the true Dharma,

original: pāriplava prasādasya prajñā na paripūryate //
analyzed: pāriplava prasādasya prajñā na paripūryate
translated: The faith that wanders, wisdom is not fulfilled.

original: srotāṃsi yasya ṣaṭ triṃśan manaḥ prasravaṇāni hi /
analyzed: srotāṃsi yasya ṣaḍ triṃśat manaḥ prasravaṇāni hi
translated: For one who has thirty-six streams, which are the springs of the mind,

original: vahanti nityam durdṛṣṭeḥ saṃkalpair gredha nihśritaiḥ //
analyzed: vahanti nityam durdṛṣṭeḥ saṃkalpaiḥ gredha nihśritaiḥ
translated: Constantly flowing from wrong views, based on desires and conceptual thoughts.

original: ratim anusṛtam indriya anugam puruṣam citta vaśa anuvartakam /
analyzed: ratim anusṛtam indriya anugam puruṣam citta vaśa anuvartakam
translated: A person who follows pleasure, who is controlled by the senses, who follows the mind,

original: yaśa /iha hi jahāti sarvadā drumam iva śīrṇa phalam yathā aṇḍajaḥ //
analyzed: yaśā eha hi jahāti sarvadā drumam iva śīrṇa phalam yathā aṇḍajaḥ
translated: Here he always abandons fame, like a bird leaves a tree with fallen fruit.

original: ātāpī vihara tvam apramatto mā te kāma guṇo matheta cittam /
analyzed: ātāpī vihara tvam apramattaḥ mā te kāma guṇaḥ matheta cittam
translated: Be energetic and live heedfully, let not the objects of sensual desire disturb your mind.

original: mā loha guḍām gileḥ pramattaḥ krandan vai narakeṣu pacyamānaḥ //
analyzed: mā loha guḍām gileḥ pramattaḥ krandan vai narakeṣu pacyamānaḥ
translated: Do not, heedless, swallow a lump of iron, crying as you are cooked in the hells.

original: utthāna kāleṣu nihīna vīryo vācā balī tv ālasiko nirāśaḥ /
analyzed: kāleṣu vīryaḥ vācā balī tu ālasikaḥ nirāśaḥ
translated: At times of exertion, one of little strength, though verbally powerful, lazy and hopeless,

original: sadā eva saṃkalpa hataḥ kusīdo jñānasya mārgam satatam na vetti //
analyzed: sadā eva saṃkalpa hataḥ kusīdaḥ jñānasya mārgam satatam na vetti
translated: Always struck down by conceptual thoughts, the sloth does not always know the path of wisdom.

original: sthūlān vitarkān atha vā api sūkṣmān samudgatān māna samplava artham /
analyzed: sthūlān vitarkān atha vā api sūkṣmān samudgatān māna samplava artham
translated: Gross or subtle thoughts, which arise for the purpose of the confusion of pride,

original: vitarkayan vai satatam vitarkān etām sadā dhāvati bhrānta cittaḥ //
analyzed: vitarkayan vai satatam vitarkān etām sadā dhāvati bhrānta cittaḥ
translated: Always reflecting on these thoughts, he always runs around with a confused mind.

original: etāṃs tu vidyān manaso vitarkān ātāpavān saṃvaravān smṛta ātmā /
analyzed: etān tu vidyāt manasaḥ vitarkān ātāpavān saṃvaravān smṛtaḥ ātmā
translated: But one who is diligent, restrained, and mindful of the self should know these thoughts of the mind.

original: jahāty aśeṣān apunar bhavāya samāhito dhyāna rataḥ sumedhāḥ //
analyzed: jahāti aśeṣān apunar bhavāya samāhitaḥ dhyāna rataḥ sumedhāḥ
translated: The well-concentrated one, delighting in meditation, the wise one, abandons them all without remainder, for the sake of not being reborn.

original: kumbha upamam kāyam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca /
analyzed: kumbha upamam kāyam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca
translated: Knowing this body to be like a pot, and the mind to be like a city,

original: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣed aniveśanaḥ syāt //
analyzed: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣet aniveśanaḥ syāt
translated: One should fight Mara with the weapon of wisdom. Having conquered, one should guard it and be without a home.

original: phena upamam kāyam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca /
analyzed: phena upamam kāyam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca
translated: Knowing this body to be like foam, and the mind to be like a city,

original: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣed aniveśanaḥ syāt //
analyzed: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣet aniveśanaḥ syāt
translated: One should fight Mara with the weapon of wisdom. Having conquered, one should guard it and be without a home.

original: kumbha upamam lokam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca /
analyzed: kumbha upamam lokam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca
translated: Knowing this world to be like a pot, and the mind to be like a city,

original: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣed aniveśanaḥ syāt //
analyzed: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣet aniveśanaḥ syāt
translated: One should fight Mara with the weapon of wisdom. Having conquered, one should guard it and be without a home.

original: phena upamam lokam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca /
analyzed: phena upamam lokam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam adhiṣṭhitam ca
translated: Knowing this world to be like foam, and the mind to be like a city,

original: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣed aniveśanaḥ syāt //
analyzed: yudhyeta māram prajñā yuddhena jitam ca rakṣet aniveśanaḥ syāt
translated: He should fight Māra with the weapon of wisdom, and having conquered, should guard his victory without attachment.

original: sambhodhy aṅgeṣu yeṣāṃs tu samyak cittam subhāvitam /
analyzed: sambhodhi aṅgeṣu yeṣām tu samyak cittam su bhāvitam
translated: Those who have well-developed minds in the factors of awakening,

original: ādānam pratinihsṛjya ca anupādāyam āśritāḥ /
analyzed: ādānam pratinihsṛjya ca anupādāyam āśritāḥ
translated: having abandoned grasping and giving up, rely on non-attachment.

original: kṣīṇa āsravā vānta doṣās te loke parinirvṛtāḥ //
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsravāḥ vānta doṣāḥ te loke parinirvṛtāḥ
translated: Their defilements are exhausted, their faults are cleansed, they are fully liberated in the world.

original: sva cittam anurakṣam vai sva vālam camarī yathā /
analyzed: sva cittam anurakṣam vai sva vālam camarī yathā
translated: Protecting one's own mind like a hair-tuft on the crown of the head,

original: bhūteṣu ca dayā āpannaḥ sukhān na parihīyate //
analyzed: bhūteṣu ca dayā āpannaḥ sukhāt na parihīyate
translated: and full of compassion for beings, one does not fall away from happiness.

original: etam nāgasya nāgena tv īṣā dantasya hastinaḥ /
analyzed: etam nāgasya nāgena tu īṣā dantasya hastinaḥ
translated: This is the meeting of the elephant with the tusk of the elephant,

original: sameti cittam cittena yad eko ramate vane //
analyzed: sameti cittam cittena yat ekaḥ ramate vane
translated: the meeting of the mind with the mind, when one delights in the forest alone.

original: avyāpannena cittena yo bhūtāny anukampate /
analyzed: a vyāpannena cittena yaḥ bhūtāni anukampate
translated: One who has a non-harming mind and is compassionate towards beings,

original: maitraḥ sa sarva sattveṣu vairam tasya na kenacit //
analyzed: maitraḥ sa sarva sattveṣu vairam tasya na kenacid
translated: he is friendly towards all beings, he has no enmity with anyone.

original: avyāpannena cittena yo bhūtāny anukampate /
analyzed: a vyāpannena cittena yaḥ bhūtāni anukampate
translated: One who has a non-harming mind and is compassionate towards beings,

original: maitraḥ sa sarva prāṇeṣu vairam tasya na kenacit //
analyzed: maitraḥ sa sarva prāṇeṣu vairam tasya na kenacid
translated: he is friendly towards all living beings, he has no enmity with anyone.

original: avyāpannena cittena yo bhūtāny anukampate /
analyzed: a vyāpannena cittena yaḥ bhūtāni anukampate
translated: One who has a non-harming mind and is compassionate towards beings,

original: maitraḥ sa sarva bhūteṣu vairam tasya na kenacit //
analyzed: maitraḥ sa sarva bhūteṣu vairam tasya na kenacid
translated: he is friendly towards all creatures, he has no enmity with anyone.

original: ekam api cet prāṇam aduṣṭa citto maitrāyate kuśalam tena hi syāt /
analyzed: ekam api ced prāṇam aduṣṭa cittaḥ maitrāyate kuśalam tena hi syāt
translated: If one with a pure mind shows friendliness even to a single being, then by that one would be virtuous.

original: sarvāṃs tu sattvān manasā anukampayan prabhūtam āryaḥ prakaroti puṇyam / sattvām
analyzed: sarvān tu sattvān manasā anukampayan prabhūtam āryaḥ prakaroti puṇyam sattvām
translated: But the noble one, with a mind full of compassion for all beings, creates abundant merit.

original: yo hy udagreṇa cittena tv adīnena sadā naraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi udagreṇa cittena tu adīnena sadā naraḥ
translated: For the man who always, with an exalted and undaunted mind,

original: bhāvayet kuśalān dharmān yoga kṣemasya prāptaye //
analyzed: bhāvayet kuśalān dharmān yoga kṣemasya prāptaye
translated: cultivates wholesome states for the attainment of union and safety.

original: śāntam asya mano bhavati śāntā vāk kāya karma ca /
analyzed: śāntam asya manaḥ bhavati śāntā vāc kāya karma ca
translated: His mind becomes tranquil, his speech and bodily action are tranquil,

original: samyag ājñā vimuktasya hy upaśāntasya bhikṣuṇaḥ //
analyzed: samyak ājñā vimuktasya hi upaśāntasya bhikṣuṇaḥ
translated: of the monk who is well liberated by right knowledge, who is tranquil.

original: pañca aṅgikena tūryeṇa na ratir bhavati tādṛśī /
analyzed: pañca aṅgikena tūryeṇa na ratiḥ bhavati tādṛśī
translated: There is no such delight as with a five-part musical instrument,

original: yādṛśy eka agra cittasya samyag dharmān vipaśyataḥ //
analyzed: eka agra cittasya samyak dharmān vipaśyataḥ
translated: as with one-pointed mind, rightly contemplating the Dhamma.

original: sukham svapanti munayo na te śocanti māmikām /
analyzed: sukham svapanti munayaḥ na te śocanti māmikām
translated: The sages sleep happily, they do not grieve for my sake,

original: yeṣām dhyāna ratam cittam kāmas teṣām na vidyate //
analyzed: yeṣām dhyāna ratam cittam kāmaḥ teṣām na vidyate
translated: for those whose mind is devoted to meditation, desire does not exist for them.

original: sukham modanti munayo na te śocanti māmikām /
analyzed: sukham modanti munayaḥ na te śocanti māmikām
translated: The sages rejoice happily, they do not grieve for my sake,

original: yeṣām dhyāna ratam cittam vartmas teṣām na vidyate //
analyzed: yeṣām dhyāna ratam cittam vartmas teṣām na vidyate
translated: for those whose mind is devoted to meditation, the path does not exist for them.

original: yasya śaila upamam cittam sthitam na anuprakampate /
analyzed: yasya śaila upamam cittam sthitam na anuprakampate
translated: He whose mind is like a mountain, standing firm and not shaking,

original: viraktam rajanīyebhyaḥ kopanīye na kupyate /
analyzed: viraktam rajanīyebhyaḥ kopanīye na kupyate
translated: He who is detached from things that cause passion, does not get angry at things that cause anger.

original: yasya evam bhāvitam cittam kutas tam duhkham eṣyati //
analyzed: yasya evam bhāvitam cittam kutas tam duhkham eṣyati
translated: How can suffering come to him whose mind is thus developed?

original: na upavādī na upaghātī prīti mokṣe ca saṃvaraḥ /
analyzed: na upavādī na upaghātī prīti mokṣe ca saṃvaraḥ
translated: He who does not revile, does not harm, is restrained in pleasure and liberation,

original: mātrajñatā ca bhakteṣu prāntam ca śayana āsanam /
analyzed: mātrajña tā ca bhakteṣu prāntam ca śayana āsanam
translated: knows moderation in food, and has a secluded bed and seat,

original: adhicitte samāyoga /etad buddhasya śāsanam //
analyzed: adhicitte samāyoga etat buddhasya śāsanam
translated: is devoted to mental training - this is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: citta nimittasya kovidaḥ pravivekasya rasam prajānakaḥ /
analyzed: citta nimittasya kovidaḥ pravivekasya rasam prajānakaḥ
translated: He who is skilled in the signs of the mind, who knows the taste of solitude,

original: dhyāyī nipakaḥ pratismṛto vetti prīti sukham nirāmiṣam //
analyzed: dhyāyī nipakaḥ pratismṛtaḥ vetti prīti sukham nirāmiṣam
translated: the meditator, the wise one, the mindful one, experiences the joy and happiness that is free from worldly desires.

original: manaś ca yo rakṣati bhāṣitam ca ceṣṭe ca kāyasya sadā eva yuktaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ ca yaḥ rakṣati bhāṣitam ca ceṣṭe ca kāyasya sadā eva yuktaḥ
translated: He who always guards the mind, speech and actions of the body,

original: sa prāpya śokam hi na duhkhitaḥ syāt satya sthitaḥ satyavidaḥ sumedhāḥ //
analyzed: sa prāpya śokam hi na duhkhitaḥ syāt satya sthitaḥ satyavidaḥ sumedhāḥ
translated: having attained sorrow, would not be unhappy, being established in truth, the wise one who knows truth.

original: arakṣitena cittena mithyā dṛṣṭi hatena ca /
analyzed: arakṣitena cittena mithyā dṛṣṭi hatena ca
translated: With an unguarded mind, destroyed by wrong views,

original: stīna middha abhibhūtena vaśam mṛtyor nigacchati / stīnamiddhābhibhūtena
analyzed: stīnamiddha abhibhūtena vaśam mṛtyoḥ nigacchati stīnamiddha abhibhūtena
translated: overcome by sloth and torpor, one comes under the power of death, overcome by sloth and torpor.

original: tasmād rakṣita cittaḥ syāt samyak saṃkalpa gocaraḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt rakṣita cittaḥ syāt samyak saṃkalpa gocaraḥ
translated: Therefore, one should guard the mind, having the domain of right thought,

original: samyag dṛṣṭi puraskāro jñātvā caiva udaya vyayam /
analyzed: samyak dṛṣṭi puraskāraḥ jñātvā ca eva udaya vyayam
translated: Having understood the arising and passing away, with right view at the forefront,

original: stīna middha abhibhūr bhikṣuḥ sarva durgatayo jahet //
analyzed: bhikṣuḥ sarva durgatayaḥ jahet
translated: the monk who overcomes sloth and torpor abandons all bad destinies.

original: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata /
analyzed: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata
translated: For the restraint of the mind is happiness. Guard the mind, do not be heedless.

original: cittena hi vañcitā prajā hy ekatyā narakeṣu pacyate //
analyzed: cittena hi vañcitā prajā hi ekatyā narakeṣu pacyate
translated: For people deceived by the mind are cooked in the hells, some.

original: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata /
analyzed: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata
translated: For the restraint of the mind is happiness. Guard the mind, do not be heedless.

original: cittena hi vañcitā prajā hy ekatyā tīryakṣu pacyate // tiryakṣu
analyzed: cittena hi vañcitā prajā hi ekatyā tīryakṣu pacyate tiryakṣu
translated: For people deceived by the mind are cooked among the animals, some.

original: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata /
analyzed: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata
translated: For the restraint of the mind is happiness. Guard the mind, do not be heedless.

original: cittena hi vañcitā prajā hy ekatyā preteṣu pacyate //
analyzed: cittena hi vañcitā prajā hi ekatyā preteṣu pacyate
translated: For people deceived by the mind are cooked among the ghosts, some.

original: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata /
analyzed: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata
translated: For the restraint of the mind is happiness. Guard the mind, do not be heedless.

original: citte tu surakṣite prajā hy ekatyā manujeṣu modate //
analyzed: citte tu su rakṣite prajā hi ekatyā manujeṣu modate
translated: For people who guard the mind well rejoice among humans, some.

original: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata /
analyzed: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata
translated: For the restraint of the mind is happiness. Guard the mind, do not be heedless.

original: citte tu surakṣite prajā hy ekatyā svargeṣu modate //
analyzed: citte tu su rakṣite prajā hi ekatyā svargeṣu modate
translated: For people who guard the mind well rejoice in the heavens, some.

original: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata /
analyzed: cittasya hi samyamaḥ sukham cittam rakṣata mā pramadyata
translated: For the mind's restraint is happiness. Guard the mind, do not be heedless.

original: citte tu surakṣite prajā hy ekatyā nirvāṇam āpnute //
analyzed: citte tu su rakṣite prajā hi ekatyā nirvāṇam āpnute
translated: But when the mind is well-guarded, some beings attain nirvana.

original: bhikṣuvarga
analyzed: bhikṣu varga
translated: The Chapter on Monks

original: piṇḍa cārikāya bhikṣave hy ātma bharāya hi na anya poṣiṇe /
analyzed: piṇḍa cārikāya bhikṣave hi ātma bharāya hi na anya poṣiṇe
translated: For the monk who goes for alms, who is self-sufficient and does not support others,

original: devāḥ spṛhayanti tāyine hy upaśāntāya sadā smṛta ātmane //
analyzed: devāḥ spṛhayanti tāyine hi upaśāntāya sadā smṛtaḥ ātmane
translated: The gods envy the one who is protected, who is always peaceful and mindful of the self.

original: piṇḍa pātikāya bhikṣave hy ātma bharāya hi na anya poṣiṇe /
analyzed: piṇḍa pātikāya bhikṣave hi ātma bharāya hi na anya poṣiṇe
translated: For the monk who goes for alms, who is self-sufficient and does not support others,

original: devāḥ spṛhayanti tāyine na tu satkāra yaśo abhikāṅkṣine //
analyzed: devāḥ spṛhayanti tāyine na tu satkāra yaśaḥ abhikāṅkṣine
translated: The gods envy the one who is protected, but not the one who desires honor and fame.

original: sarva karma jahasya bhikṣuṇe dhunvānasya puraskṛtam rajaḥ /
analyzed: sarva karma jahasya bhikṣuṇe dhunvānasya puraskṛtam rajaḥ
translated: For the monk who has abandoned all actions, who shakes off the dust that is placed in front,

original: amamasya sadā sthita ātmano hy artho na asti janasya lāpanam //
analyzed: amamasya sadā sthitaḥ ātmanaḥ hi arthaḥ na asti janasya lāpanam
translated: Who is without possessions and always has a settled mind, there is no purpose in speaking to people.

original: tudanti vācābhir asamyatā janāḥ śarair hi saṃgrāma gatam yathā gajam /
analyzed: tudanti vācābhiḥ asamyatāḥ janāḥ śaraiḥ hi saṃgrāma gatam yathā gajam
translated: People strike with words, just as in a battle they strike an elephant with arrows.

original: śrutvā tu vācām paruṣām udīritām adhivāsayed bhikṣur aduṣṭa cittaḥ //
analyzed: śrutvā tu vācām paruṣām udīritām adhivāsayet bhikṣuḥ aduṣṭa cittaḥ
translated: But a monk should endure harsh words that are spoken, with an untroubled mind.

original: yas tv alpa jīvī laghur ātma kāmo yata indriyaḥ sarva gatiḥ pramuktaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu alpa jīvī laghuḥ ātma kāmaḥ yatas indriyaḥ sarva gatiḥ pramuktaḥ
translated: But one who has a short life, who is quick, who desires his own self, who has controlled his senses, who is released from all destinies,

original: anokasārī hy amamo nirāśaḥ kāmam jahaś ca eka caraḥ sa bhikṣuḥ //🔽mātram bhajeta pratirūpam śuddha ājīvo bhavet sadā /
analyzed: an oka sārī hi amamaḥ nirāśaḥ kāmam jahaḥ ca eka caraḥ sa bhikṣuḥ  mātram bhajeta pratirūpam śuddhaḥ ājīvaḥ bhavet sadā
translated: The monk who is not a householder, who is free from possessions, who is without hope, who has given up desire, who is solitary, he is a true monk.🔽He should maintain himself with just enough, be suitable, and always have pure livelihood.

original: pratisaṃstāra vṛttiḥ syād ācāra kuśalo bhavet /
analyzed: pratisaṃstāra vṛttiḥ syāt ācāra kuśalaḥ bhavet
translated: He should have a lifestyle of contentment, and be skilled in conduct.

original: tataḥ pramodya bahulaḥ smṛto bhikṣuḥ parivrajet //
analyzed: tatas pramodya bahulaḥ smṛtaḥ bhikṣuḥ parivrajet
translated: Then, being very joyful, the monk should wander mindfully.

original: hasta samyataḥ pāda samyato vācā samyataḥ sarva samyataḥ /
analyzed: hasta samyataḥ pāda samyataḥ vācā samyataḥ sarva samyataḥ
translated: Controlled in hands, controlled in feet, controlled in speech, controlled in everything,

original: ādhyātma rataḥ samāhito hy ekaḥ saṃtuṣito hi yaḥ sa bhikṣuḥ //
analyzed: rataḥ samāhitaḥ hi ekaḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ hi yaḥ sa bhikṣuḥ
translated: The one who is inwardly delighted, concentrated, and content, he is a true monk.

original: dharma ārāmo dharma rato dharmam eva anucintayan /
analyzed: dharma ārāmaḥ dharma rataḥ dharmam eva anucintayan
translated: Delighting in the Dharma, devoted to the Dharma, contemplating only the Dharma,

original: dharmam ca anusmaran bhikṣur dharmān na parihīyate //
analyzed: dharmam ca anusmaran bhikṣuḥ dharmāt na parihīyate
translated: The monk who recollects the Dharma does not fall away from the Dharmas.

original: śunya agāram praviṣṭasya prahita ātmasya bhikṣuṇaḥ / śūnya agāram
analyzed: śunya agāram praviṣṭasya prahita ātmasya bhikṣuṇaḥ śūnya agāram
translated: For the monk who has entered an empty house, who has a mind free from attachment,

original: amānuṣā ratir bhavati samyag dharmān vipaśyataḥ //
analyzed: amānuṣā ratiḥ bhavati samyak dharmān vipaśyataḥ
translated: The delight of the non-human beings arises, who see the Dharma correctly.

original: yato yataḥ saṃspṛśati skandhānām udaya vyayam /
analyzed: yatas yatas saṃspṛśati skandhānām udaya vyayam
translated: From whatever place he touches the arising and passing away of the aggregates,

original: prāmodyam labhate tatra prītyā sukham analpakam /
analyzed: prāmodyam labhate tatra prītyā sukham analpakam
translated: He obtains joy there, and from that joy, immeasurable happiness.

original: tataḥ prāmodya bahulaḥ smṛto bhikṣuḥ parivrajet //
analyzed: tatas prāmodya bahulaḥ smṛtaḥ bhikṣuḥ parivrajet
translated: Then, being very joyful, the monk should wander mindfully.

original: yathā api parvataḥ śailo vāyunā na prakampate /
analyzed: yathā api parvataḥ śailaḥ vāyunā na prakampate
translated: Just as a mountain, a peak, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam rāga kṣayād bhikṣuḥ śailavan na prakampate //
analyzed: evam rāga kṣayāt bhikṣuḥ śailavat na prakampate
translated: so a monk, through the destruction of passion, is unshaken like a mountain.

original: yathā api parvataḥ śailo vāyunā na prakampate /
analyzed: yathā api parvataḥ śailaḥ vāyunā na prakampate
translated: Just as a mountain, a peak, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam dveṣa kṣayād bhikṣuḥ śailavan na prakampate //
analyzed: evam dveṣa kṣayāt bhikṣuḥ śailavat na prakampate
translated: so a monk, through the destruction of hatred, is unshaken like a mountain.

original: yathā api parvataḥ śailo vāyunā na prakampate /
analyzed: yathā api parvataḥ śailaḥ vāyunā na prakampate
translated: Just as a mountain, a peak, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam moha kṣayād bhikṣuḥ śailavan na prakampate //
analyzed: evam moha kṣayāt bhikṣuḥ śaila vat na prakampate
translated: so a monk, through the destruction of delusion, is unshaken like a mountain.

original: yathā api parvataḥ śailo vāyunā na prakampate /
analyzed: yathā api parvataḥ śailaḥ vāyunā na prakampate
translated: Just as a mountain, a peak, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam māna kṣayād bhikṣuḥ śailavan na prakampate //
analyzed: evam māna kṣayāt bhikṣuḥ śaila vat na prakampate
translated: so a monk, through the destruction of conceit, is unshaken like a mountain.

original: yathā api parvataḥ śailo vāyunā na prakampate /
analyzed: yathā api parvataḥ śailaḥ vāyunā na prakampate
translated: Just as a mountain, a peak, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam lobha kṣayād bhikṣuḥ śailavan na prakampate //
analyzed: evam lobha kṣayāt bhikṣuḥ śailavat na prakampate
translated: so a monk, through the destruction of greed, is unshaken like a mountain.

original: yathā api parvataḥ śailo vāyunā na prakampate /
analyzed: yathā api parvataḥ śailaḥ vāyunā na prakampate
translated: Just as a mountain, a peak, is not shaken by the wind,

original: evam tṛṣṇā kṣayād bhikṣuḥ śailavan na prakampate //
analyzed: evam tṛṣṇā kṣayāt bhikṣuḥ śaila vat na prakampate
translated: so a monk, through the destruction of craving, is unshaken like a mountain.

original: yasya samnicayo na asti yasya na asti mamāyitam /
analyzed: yasya samnicayaḥ na asti yasya na asti mamāyitam
translated: He who has no store, he who has nothing that he calls his own,

original: asantam śocate na eva sa vai bhikṣur nirucyate /
analyzed: asantam śocate na eva sa vai bhikṣuḥ nirucyate
translated: he who does not grieve for what is not, he is truly called a monk.

original: bhikṣur na tāvatā bhavati yāvatā bhikṣate parān /
analyzed: bhikṣuḥ na tāvatā bhavati yāvatā bhikṣate parān
translated: A monk is not so by merely begging from others.

original: veṣmān dharmān samādāya bhikṣur bhavati na tāvatā //
analyzed: veṣmān dharmān samādāya bhikṣuḥ bhavati na tāvatā
translated: By adopting the right conduct, one becomes a monk, not merely by that.

original: yas tu puṇyam ca pāpam ca prahāya brahmacaryavān /
analyzed: yaḥ tu puṇyam ca pāpam ca prahāya brahmacaryavān
translated: But he who, having abandoned merit and demerit, lives a holy life,

original: viśreṇayitvā carati sa vai bhikṣur nirucyate //
analyzed: viśreṇayitvā carati sa vai bhikṣuḥ nirucyate
translated: and practices with discrimination, he is truly called a monk.

original: maitrā vihārī yo bhikṣuḥ prasanno buddha śāsane /
analyzed: maitrā vihārī yaḥ bhikṣuḥ prasannaḥ buddha śāsane
translated: The monk who dwells in loving-kindness, who is serene in the Buddha's teaching,

original: adhigacchet padam śāntam asecanaka darśanam //
analyzed: adhigacchet padam śāntam asecanaka darśanam
translated: will attain the peaceful state, which is not delightful to behold.

original: maitrā vihārī yo bhikṣuḥ prasanno buddha śāsane /
analyzed: maitrā vihārī yaḥ bhikṣuḥ prasannaḥ buddha śāsane
translated: The monk who dwells in loving-kindness, who is serene in the Buddha's teaching,

original: adhigacchet padam śāntam saṃskāra upaśamam sukham //
analyzed: adhigacchet padam śāntam saṃskāra upaśamam sukham
translated: will attain the peaceful state, the bliss of the cessation of conditioned things.

original: maitrā vihārī yo bhikṣuḥ prasanno buddha śāsane /
analyzed: maitrā vihārī yaḥ bhikṣuḥ prasannaḥ buddha śāsane
translated: The monk who dwells in loving-kindness, who is serene in the Buddha's teaching,

original: abhavyaḥ parihāṇāya nirvāṇasya eva so antike //
analyzed: abhavyaḥ parihāṇāya nirvāṇasya eva saḥ antike
translated: is incapable of falling away, he is near to Nibbāna.

original: udagra cittaḥ sumanā hy abhibhūya priya apriyam / priyā priyam
analyzed: udagra cittaḥ sumanāḥ hi abhibhūya priya apriyam priya a priyam
translated: With uplifted mind, joyful, having overcome what is dear and what is not dear,

original: prāmodya bahulo bhikṣur duhkha kṣayam avāpnuyāt //🔽śānta kāyaḥ / / / / / / / / / / / / / /śānta vāk susamāhitaḥ /
analyzed: prāmodya bahulaḥ bhikṣuḥ duhkha kṣayam avāpnuyāt  śānta kāyaḥ śānta vāc su samāhitaḥ
translated: the monk who is full of joy, will attain the destruction of suffering.🔽The monk whose body is tranquil, whose speech is tranquil, who is well concentrated,

original: vānta loka āmiṣo bhikṣur upaśānto nirucyate //
analyzed: vānta loke āmiṣaḥ bhikṣuḥ upaśāntaḥ nirucyate
translated: who has cast off worldly goods, is called peaceful and restrained.

original: na asty aprajñasya vai dhyānam prajñā na dhyāyato asti ca /
analyzed: na asti aprajñasya vai dhyānam prajñā na dhyāyataḥ asti ca
translated: There is no meditation for one who is not wise, and there is no wisdom for one who does not meditate.

original: yasya dhyānam tathā prajñā sa vai nirvāṇa sāntike //
analyzed: yasya dhyānam tathā prajñā sa vai nirvāṇa sāntike
translated: He who has meditation and wisdom is near to nirvana.

original: tasmād dhyānam tathā prajñām anuyujyeta paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt dhyānam tathā prajñām anuyujyeta paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Therefore, the wise one should practice meditation and wisdom.

original: tasya aham ādir bhavati tathā prājñasya bhikṣuṇaḥ //🔽saṃtuṣṭir indriyair guptiḥ prātimokṣe ca saṃvaraḥ /
analyzed: tasya aham ādiḥ bhavati tathā prājñasya bhikṣuṇaḥ  saṃtuṣṭiḥ indriyaiḥ guptiḥ prātimokṣe ca saṃvaraḥ
translated: I am the beginning for him, for the wise monk.🔽Contentment, guarding the senses, restraint in the Prātimokṣa,

original: mātrajñatā ca bhakteṣu prāntam ca śayana āsanam //
analyzed: mātrajña tā ca bhakteṣu prāntam ca śayana āsanam
translated: knowing moderation in food, and dwelling in secluded places.

original: adhicitte samāyogam yasya asau bhikṣur ucyate //
analyzed: adhicitte samāyogam yasya asau bhikṣuḥ ucyate
translated: The monk who is devoted to higher mind is called a true monk.

original: yasya kāyena vācā ca manasā ca na duṣkṛtam /
analyzed: yasya kāyena vācā ca manasā ca na duṣkṛtam
translated: For one who has no evil deeds by body, speech, or mind,

original: kalyāṇa śīlam āhus tam hrīmantam bhikṣum uttamam //
analyzed: kalyāṇa śīlam āhus tam hrīmantam bhikṣum uttamam
translated: they call him a monk of good conduct, modest, and supreme.

original: dharmāḥ subhāvitā yasya sapta sambhodha pakṣikāḥ /
analyzed: dharmāḥ subhāvitāḥ yasya sapta sambhodha pakṣikāḥ
translated: For one who has well cultivated the seven factors of awakening,

original: kalyāṇa dharmam āhus tam sadā bhikṣum samāhitam //
analyzed: kalyāṇa dharmam āhuḥ tam sadā bhikṣum samāhitam
translated: they call him a monk of good qualities, always concentrated.

original: iha eva yaḥ prajānāti duhkhasya kṣayam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: iha eva yaḥ prajānāti duhkhasya kṣayam ātmanaḥ
translated: One who knows right here the end of suffering for oneself,

original: kalyāṇa prajñam āhus tam sadā śīlam anāsravam //
analyzed: kalyāṇa prajñam āhuḥ tam sadā śīlam anāsravam
translated: they call him a monk of good wisdom, always of pure conduct.

original: na śīla vrata mātreṇa bahuśrutyena vā punaḥ / bāhuśrutyena
analyzed: na śīla vrata mātreṇa bahuśrutyena vā punar bāhuśrutyena
translated: Not by mere morality and vows, or by much learning,

original: tathā samādhi lābhena vivikta śayanena vā //
analyzed: tathā samādhi lābhena vivikta śayanena vā
translated: or by the attainment of concentration, or by solitary dwelling,

original: bhikṣur viśvāsam āpadyed aprāpte hy āsrava kṣaye /
analyzed: bhikṣuḥ viśvāsam āpadyet aprāpte hi āsrava kṣaye
translated: a monk should have confidence, before attaining the destruction of the defilements.

original: spṛśet tu sambodhi sukham akāpuruṣa sevitam //
analyzed: spṛśet tu sambodhi sukham akāpuruṣa sevitam
translated: But he should touch the bliss of perfect enlightenment, which is not frequented by ordinary people.

original: tāpa jāto hy ayam lokaḥ skandhā na ātmā iti manyate /
analyzed: tāpa jātaḥ hi ayam lokaḥ skandhāḥ naḥ ātmā iti manyate
translated: This world is born of heat, and thinks that the aggregates are the self.

original: manyate yena yena aham tat tad bhavati ca anyathā //
analyzed: manyate yena yena aham tat tat bhavati ca anyathā
translated: By whatever he thinks, That is me, it becomes otherwise.

original: loko ayam anyathā bhūto bhava sakto bhave rataḥ /
analyzed: lokaḥ ayam anyathā bhūtaḥ bhava saktaḥ bhave rataḥ
translated: This world is otherwise than it seems, attached to existence, delighting in existence,

original: bhava abhinandī satatam bhavān na parimucyate //
analyzed: bhava abhinandī satatam bhavāt na parimucyate
translated: always longing for existence, it is not liberated from existence.

original: yan nandate sa hi bhavo duhkhasya sa bibheti ca /
analyzed: yat nandate sa hi bhavaḥ duhkhasya sa bibheti ca
translated: What delights him, that is existence, and he fears suffering.

original: uṣyate bhava hānāya brahmacaryam mama antike //
analyzed: uṣyate bhava hānāya brahmacaryam mama antike
translated: He dwells in celibacy near me for the destruction of existence.

original: ye bhavena bhavasya eva prāhur nihsaraṇam sadā /
analyzed: ye bhavena bhavasya eva prāhuḥ nihsaraṇam sadā
translated: Those who always declare existence to be the escape from existence,

original: anihsṛtān bhavā sarvāṃs tān vadāmi sadā v /aham // /
analyzed: a nihsṛtān bhava sarvān tān vadāmi sadā vaham
translated: I always declare them to be not completely escaped from all existences.

original: pratītya duhkham upadhim bhavaty upadhi sambhavam /
analyzed: pratītya duhkham upadhim bhavati upadhi sambhavam
translated: Suffering arises in dependence on clinging, and clinging arises from existence.

original: kṣayāt sarva upadhīnām tu na asti duhkhasya sambhavaḥ //
analyzed: kṣayāt sarva upadhīnām tu na asti duhkhasya sambhavaḥ
translated: But when all the bases of existence are destroyed, suffering does not arise.

original: anityā hi bhavāḥ sarve duhkhā vipariṇāminaḥ /
analyzed: anityāḥ hi bhavāḥ sarve duhkhāḥ vipariṇāminaḥ
translated: All existences are impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: paśyataḥ prajñayā sarve kṣīyante na abhinanditāḥ //
analyzed: paśyataḥ prajñayā sarve kṣīyante na abhinanditāḥ
translated: When one sees them all with wisdom, they are destroyed and not delighted in.

original: nirvṛtasya sadā bhikṣor āyatyām upaśāmyate /
analyzed: nirvṛtasya sadā bhikṣoḥ āyatyām upaśāmyate
translated: For a monk who is always peaceful, who has attained cessation,

original: abhibhūto bhavaḥ sarvo duhkha antaḥ sa nirucyate //
analyzed: abhibhūtaḥ bhavaḥ sarvaḥ duhkha antaḥ sa nirucyate
translated: all existence is overcome, and that is declared to be the end of suffering.

original: sadā upaśānta cittasya vastuc chinnasya bhikṣuṇaḥ /
analyzed: sadā upaśānta cittasya vastuc chinnasya bhikṣuṇaḥ
